loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Valientes (Brave women) 1, located in the rural area surrounding La Romana. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Santa is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, where she sells chicken, pork, beef and meat sausages. She will use the profits to buy a battery for her power generator and to save to buy her own house. She said that her most difficult challenge is to travel, as she would like to visit other countries like Hawaii.  This is one of her most cherished dream as she wants to meet other cultures. Her future plans are to have her own house, to have a successful and sustainable business, and then to travel to different countries.

She started doing her business almost three years ago with some money she saved, and she is taking Esperanza´s loan because they are comfortable to do business with. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Quiton

texts.en:
Quilton is 31 years old and runs a farm in his home area in Kitale, Western Kenya, where he has been practicing his farming business actively for the last four years.  He currently produces eggs and vegetables. He also rides a motorcycle for additional income.

Quilton has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds to improve the income from his poultry business. He says the income will  help him pay for the education of his children.

Quilton says the challenge in farming remains the high costs of treatment for  birds.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Malama

texts.en:
Malama is a 40-year-old woman who is married with 5 children.  She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    

Malama  needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 Talas per week) to continue improving her land.

Malama  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Malama 's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy seeds, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi est un homme âgé  de 28ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse avec 02 enfants en charge.
Komi travaille comme frigoriste(il répare et vend les frigidaires) depuis 2008. Il exerce son activité avec 03 personnes dans un quartier de la place et s’approvisionne au Port Autonome de Lomé.
Komi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des congélateurs, des réfrigérateurs. Il veut réinvestir dans son activité et s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Komi is a 28-year-old man. He is married to a retailer and has two children to support. He has been working as a refrigerator expert (he repairs and sells Frigidaires) since 2008. He operates with three persons in a local neighborhood and stocks up at the Autonomous Port of Lomé. 

Komi has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy freezers and refrigerators. He wants to reinvest in his business and to thrive.

loans.use: to buy freezers and refrigerators

loans.name: Ma Orbelinda

texts.es:
Ma Orbelinda tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos entre 23 y 14 años de edad, vive con su familia en Taulabe, Comayagua.
Ma Orbelinda tiene su propio negocio de una pequeña pulpería. La cual inicio con fondos propios hace un año. Y ofrece a sus clientes productos alimenticios, como Frijoles, arroz, harina, azúcar, manteca, golosinas, refrescos, y también productos de abarrotería como jabón, pastas, detergentes, etc. Ella obtuvo este negocio impulsada por la situación de falta de empleo para poder generar ingresos que ayudaran a los gastos diarios del hogar. Ella atiende su pulpería desde muy temprano.
Solicito un préstamo con ODEF de 5,000 lempiras para invertir en compra de productos alimenticios como maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, harina, azúcar, refrescos, golosinas. Para incrementar el inventario y por consiguiente generar mejores ingresos.
Su meta es mejorar el local del negocio, poder hacerlo mas amplio y seguir adelante y ayudar a su familia con los gastos necesarios.
texts.en:
María Orbelinda, 42, is married and her husband works in agriculture; she has four children whose ages range between 23 and 14 years.  She lives with her family in Taulabe, Comayagua.

María Orbelinda has her own business, a small grocery store.  She started it a year ago with her own funds.  She sells food items like beans, rice, flour, sugar, lard, snacks and soft-drinks and also grocery items like soap, toothpaste, detergent, etc.

She went into this business motivated by the lack of employment opportunities and the need she had to help cover everyday household expenses.  She tends to her store starting very early.

She asked ODEF for a 5,000 lempira loan to buy food items like corn, beans, rice, sugar, flour, sugar, soft-drinks and snacks to increase inventory and as a result generate better income.  Her goal is to strengthen her business, to be able to make it larger and to continue forward and help her family with necessary expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: David Leonardo

texts.es:
David de 25 años, quien está casado desde hace un año, vive junto a su esposa en Olanchito, yoro.
Anteriormente David trabajaba como técnico en un laboratorio dental donde adquirió mucha experiencia y hace tres años se independizo creando su propio laboratorio dental. 
El ofrece servicio de elaboración de placas dentales, prótesis y placas provisionales. Atiende a sus clientes durante 6 horas diarias, todos los días.
Es su primer préstamo que solicita y lo va invertir en compra de materia prima para la elaboración de placas dentales, con el propósito de brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes 
Su sueño es comprar más equipo y tener en existencia los materiales necesarios para desempeñarse mejor en los productos que hace.
texts.en:
David, 25, has been married for a year; he lives with his wife in Olanchito, Yoro.

David used to work as a technician in a dental lab where he acquired much experience and three years ago he became independent and opened his own dental lab.  He makes dentures, prostheses and temporary dentures.  He tends to customers every day for six hours daily.

This is his first loan request and he will use it to buy raw materials to make dentures aiming at providing better customer service.  His dream is to buy more equipment and have the necessary materials on hand to better make the products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make dentures.

loans.name: Seydi Xiomara

texts.es:
La joven Seydi, es soltera, con 27 años de edad,  no tiene hijos, no tiene dependientes, con domicilio en el Barrio San José, trabaja junto con sus hermanas y su mama en la venta de tacos, enchiladas, tajadas de mínimo verde y otras golosinas. El negocio de la joven Seydi es la venta de Golosinas y también  almuerzos. Esta solicitando préstamo para la compra de verduras, carnes, maíz, refrescos, para mejorar un poco mas su negocio, ya que de esta manera lograra mayor ingreso en sus ventas y su negocio tendrá un poco mas de afluencia de clientes. La joven Seydi  es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable lucha por sobresalir con su negocio ya que tiene la actitud de comerciante, es muy emprendedora, responsable, honesta, esta solicitando ya su tercer crédito con PRISMA  de Honduras.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo - 2012
texts.en:
This young woman, Seydi, is single and 27 years old. She does not have children or dependents and she lives in the San José neighborhood. She works together with her mother and sisters, selling tacos, enchiladas, sliced green plantains, and candies. Seydi's business is selling candies and lunches. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, meat, corn, and soft drinks in order to improve her business a bit, as she will be able to earn more income this way and her business will see an influx of customers. Young Seydi is a very hard-working and responsible person who fights to improve her business, as she has the attitude of a businesswoman. She is very enterprising, responsible, and honest. She is requesting her third loan through PRISMA of Honduras.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March - 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, corn, and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Everson

texts.es:
El señor Everson, es  casado, con 29 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo que depende el, vive en casa de sus familiares junto con su hijo y su esposa en la comunidad de San Antonio, su esposa es maestra y también trabaja para brindar mas apoyo a su familia.
Su negocio es una pulpería y una farmacia, en la que vende productos como frijoles, arroz, manteca, maíz y  abarrotería en general; también vende medicamentos populares como ser panadol , alka seltzer, dolofin , suero, curas, vendas, alcohol, algodón , Nervo forza, vitaminas, entre otros.
Esta solicitando su segundo crédito a un plazo de 4 meses para la compra de granos básicos y medicamentos para surtir su negocio de esta manera lograr mayores ganancias y acaparar mas clientes para que su negocio se fortalezca cada día mas.
Entre los planes de Everson esta la idea de colocar una nueva sucursal de su negocio en el centro y también comprar un terreno para construir una casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Marzo - 2012
texts.en:
Everson is 29 years old, married, and has a dependent child.  He lives in his relative's house along with his child and wife, in the community of San Antonio.  His wife is a teacher, and also works to provide more support to his family.  

Everson has a grocery store/pharmacy, where he sells products including beans, rice, butter, corn, and general grocery items.  He also sells popular medicines such as Panadol (acetaminophen), alka seltzer, ibuprofen, saline solution, bandages, rubbing alcohol, cotton, vitamins and other products.  

He is requesting his second loan, for a duration of 4 months, to purchase staple grains and medicines to stock his store.  This way he will have better earnings and can capture more customers, making his business stronger day by day.

Among Everson's plans is the idea of establishing a new branch of his business in the town center, and also buying some land where he could build his own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - March 2012

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, corn and other products for his business

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 61 years old and is a mother of seven children, aged between 24 and 12, with five still schooling.  She has been in farming for six years in her rural home in Kitale in Western Kenya.  Her farm produces milk, eggs and maize for the local market.

Loice has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. This is her second loan after a first one of 30,000 KES.  She will use this loan to buy more poultry birds to boost her poultry business.  She plans to have a farm with at least one thousand birds at a time and rank as a major supplier of eggs for the local market.  She adds that the income will help in educating her children.

Loice appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services to farmers but notes that diseases remain a real challenge to them.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Boniface, who is in his early 20s, is single.  He has been running a cafe where he sells juice, water, milk, sodas and food like vitumbua, mandazi and  chapati, for one year now.  He works from 6:00 am to 11:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use for buying more juice, sodas and milk. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Boniface will share this loan with his loan group "Tegemeo," which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy juice, sodas and milk.

loans.name: Celia Rosa

texts.es: La señora Celia, mujer emprendedora, responsable y eforzada continua en su oficio de costurera en su casa de habitacion, siendo Afodenic y Kiva los medios de financiamiento ella agradece la confianza dada a su persona. En esta ocasión la razon de su credito es para realizar las compras de los siguientes marteriales de construccion: zinc, estandares, perlines, cemento, golosos, soldadura entre otros y de esa manera llevar a cabo la construccion de su cuarto y un bajarate para la parte en donde se encuentra ubicado el lavandero de su vivienda ; Celia tiene pensado que de aquí  a un tiempo ir haciendole mejoras a su hogar.
texts.en:
Celia, an enterprising, responsible, and hardworking woman, continues in her job as a seamstress in her house.  With financing from AFODENIC and Kiva, she is grateful for the confidence given to her.

This time the reason for her loan is to buy the following construction materials: corrugated metal roofing, pennants, gravel, cement, screws, and solder, among others.  In this way she will carry out building her room and wattle and daub for the part of the house where the washing area is located.

Celia is planning to continue making improvements on her home in the near future.

loans.use: to buy materials to build her room and wattle and daub.

loans.name: Maria Claribel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 51  años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 13 años de edad, el menor estudia y al otro ya es independiente, ella vive con sus familia en el Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña Maria tiene una actividad de un negocio de venta de comida. Inicio este negocio hace 25 años dando el servicio de venta de almuerzos a personal de varias empresas de los alrededores. Maria manifiesta que siempre le ha gustado el negocio de la venta de comida y eso la motivo a trabajar en el y aparte que es un negocio muy rentable y le deja buenas ganancias. Dedicándose desde las 9.00 am hasta la 12.00pm.
Es su segundo préstamo con ODEF de 9,000 lempiras para invertir en comprar productos alimenticios como carne, y otros insumos como leña, papel toalla, etc. para la elaboración de los alimentos.
Su meta es apoyar a su hija para que pueda terminar sus estudios, y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 51, is married and has two children who are 22 and 13 years of age; the youngest attends school and the other one is independent already.  She lives with her family in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

María’s business activity is food sales.  She started this business 25 years ago selling lunches to staff in various nearby firms.  María states that she’s always enjoyed the business of food sales and this motivated her to work in it; besides the business is very profitable and it provides good profits.  She works from 9am until noon.

This is her second ODEF loan.  It’s 9,000 lempiras that will be used to buy foodstuffs like meat and other supplies like firewood, paper towels, etc. for food preparation.  Her goal is to support her daughter so that she can complete her schooling and also to be able to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and supplies like firewood, paper towels, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca lidia tiene 51 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 22 años de edad el cual ya es una persona independiente, ella vive con un hermano y 2 sobrinos en el Municipio de Choloma Cortes.
Blanca es una mujer muy emprendedora hace 4 años estableció su taller propio de costura, elabora faldas, camisas sencillas y también hace muñecas con vestidos. Adquirió gran experiencia durante el trabajo que desempeño en una maquila. le dedica de 2.00 pm a 6.00 pm.
Ha obtenido 5 prestamos con ODEF, los que han invertido y ha logrado obtener buenas ganancias. Este préstamo actual es de 2,500 lempiras y lo utilizara para comprar materiales como telas, hilos broches, botones etc. 
Su plan es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca Lidia, 51, is a single mother; she has a 22 year old son who is already an independent person.  She lives with a brother and two nephews in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Blanca is a very enterprising woman.  Four years ago she set up her own sewing workshop.  She makes skirts, simple shirts and also dolls with dresses.  She acquired much experience during her employment at an assembly plant.  She works from 2pm until 6pm.

She’s gotten five ODEF loans that she’s invested and attained good profits with.  This current loan is for 2,500 lempiras that she’ll use to buy supplies like fabric, thread, clasps, buttons, etc.   Her plan is to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Heber Noe

texts.es:
Heber, de 24 años de edad, tiene dos años de casados, con un hijo de un año de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de Victoria Yoro.
Heber, se dedica a realizar trabajos de carpintería desde hace 5 años. Elabora mesas, sillas, puertas y marcos, chineros etc. de madera no tradicional y de color, además compra y vende madera de color.  Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero como tiene la habilidad y experiencia en este oficio de carpintería, él quería experimentar con su propio taller, pues logro iniciar con fondos propios y luego solicito un préstamo, lo que le  ayudo a incrementar sus ventas. 
Actualmente está solicitando el segundo préstamo para comprar un motor para la cortadora de madera. Su idea es desarrollar más su negocio para obtener los ingresos que solventen sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Heber, 24, has been married for two years and has a one year old son; he lives in a village in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro.

Heber has been doing carpentry work for five years.   He makes tables, chairs, doors, window frames, china cabinets, etc. out of non-traditional, colored woods.  He also buys and sells colored wood.  He used to work in agriculture but since he has experience and ability in carpentry he wanted to experiment with his own shop that he managed to start up with his own funds and then asked for a loan that helped him increase sales.

He’s currently asking for his second loan to buy a motor for his wood saw.  His idea is to develop the business more to obtain the income that will cover his needs.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his saw.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
La señora Ingrid tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, con 26, 29 y 39 años de edad, y vive en San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida.
Doña Ingrid, en busca de tener una fuente de ingresos que le ayuden a suplir las necesidades del hogar, decidió establecer su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como granos básicos, harina, manteca, pastas, salsas, especies, lácteos etc. este negocio lo tiene hace 4 años y lo inicio con fondos propios y prestamos que le han ayudado a crecer en volumen de ventas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, atiende todo el día a sus clientes.
Esta solicitando un préstamo con ODEF, para surtir de mas productos de toda clase de abarrotería, para incrementar sus ventas y ofrecer los productos que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Ingrid, 53, is a single mother of thee children who are 26, 29 and 39 years old; she lives in San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida.

Searching for a source of income that would help her cover household needs, Ingrid decided to set up a business of her own, a grocery store where she sells basic staple items like basic grains, flour, lard, pasta, sauces, spices, dairy products, etc.  She’s had the business for four years and started it with her own funds and loans that have helped her grow in sales volume.  She’s a very hardworking woman and tends to he customers every day.

She’s asking ODEF for a loan to stock her store with all kinds of grocery items to increase sales and have items customers request available.

loans.use: to stock her store with basic food staple items.

loans.name: Unificada 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIFICADA 2” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de tejido y chompas, tienda de barrio, venta y tejido de mantas.

La señora Martha, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal por primera vez y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de refrescos y abarrotes) estos productos los comprará de las personas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella no es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y de crédito.
texts.en:
The “UNIFICADA 2” Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Regional Office. It is made up of six members and has a board headed by Sra. Martha. The businesses engaged in by bank members are varied and include selling food, selling woven goods and sweaters, a neighborhood store and selling woven blankets.

Sra Martha says that this is the first time she has joined a communal bank and that currently she has a business selling food. She has been working for years and learned the business from her mother. The loan in this cycle is for expansion of her merchandise (the purchase of soft drinks and groceries). She will buy these products from distributors and later market them in her retail space.. This type of work enables her to support her family since she is unmarried and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the training workshops in the areas of health and credit.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and groceries.

loans.name: Medio Ambiente Group

texts.es:
Doña Digna tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y reside en la Comunidad de los posos, en la ciudad de Juticalpa, en el departamento de Olancho. Desde hace 15 años trabaja vendiendo cosméticos. Su negocio lo inició por una amiga que se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos y empezó a trabajar en conjunto con ella, fue así como comenzó tomando experiencia, su forma de trabajo lo hace ambulante ya que sus clientes le hacen los pedidos por anticipado. El préstamo que solicita doña digna lo necesita para comprar mercadería nueva como ser: lociones, cremas, acondicionadores para el cabello, cremas faciales, entre otros productos. 
Una de las metas de doña Digna es enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar de forma honesta, ya que es la mejor herencia que puede dejarles, sueña con ser una microempresaria de éxito y poder tener un local propio para la venta de su producto. La vida económica de doña Digna ha cambiado grandemente ya que tiene 15 años que recibe el apoyo de los préstamos de FAMA, y ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Doña Digna is 55 years old, married and has 3 children.  Her husband makes his living in agriculture.  She lives in the Posos community of the city of Juticalpa, Olancho Department.  For the last 15 years, doña Digna has worked selling cosmetics.  A friend of hers, who made her living selling cosmetics, started the business, and doña Digna started working jointly with her.  That is how she started getting experience.  She travels around to sell her products, since her customers place orders.  Doña Digna needs the requested loan to purchase new merchandise, such as: lotions, creams, hair conditioners, facial creams and other products.
One of doña Digna's goals is to teach her children to make an honest living, as that is the best legacy she can leave them.  She hopes to be a successful micro-entrepreneur and to be able to have her own shop for selling her products.  Doña Digna's financial life has changed greatly, as she has been receiving support with FAMA loans for 15 years.  She has punctually complied with her re-payment schedules.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, creams, conditioners and other items.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny de 58 años, tiene dos hijos en las edades de 25 y 27 años;  en el año 1987 se retiró de una empresa de condimentos de la ciudad para responder a la atención y cuidado de sus hijos, desde ese momento empezó a comprar cosméticos y blusas, con las cuales hacia una rifa para lograr ingresos y apoyar el gasto familiar, mientras atendía su hogar. Gradualmente empezó a vender mercancía variada y su principal clientela, fueron sus antiguos compañeros de trabajo a quienes les acreditaba mercancía, para que se la pagaran en varias partidas; así fue como hizo su primera cartera de clientes, a los que fue agregando nuevos productos paso a paso como,  calzado para tener nuevas líneas de ventas; en el año 1990 se trasladó al municipio de Barrancas, le alquiló el horno a una tienda y trabajó por espacio de 7 años. Al regresar a la ciudad de Barranquilla construyó su propia casa,  compró una vitrina y con el dinero que le quedó,  compró mercancía con la que surtió su pequeño punto de ventas, gradualmente se fue vinculando a empresas que en su proveeduría, entregaban catálogos para la promoción y venta de sus productos, así mismo tiene otra actividad que también genera ingresos como es la preparación y venta de postres y hayacas. Con esta actividad ha logrado dar estudio a sus dos hijos y sueña con verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos. En la actualidad su creciente clientela pide cada día mas productos y ante esto su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para lograrlo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará perfumes, ropa interior e insumos para la producción de hayacas y postres. Su experiencia en el trabajo, su dinamismo y su empeño en crecer, son hoy las razones de que su inversión de Kiva sea exitosa.
texts.en:
Fanny, 58, has two children who are 25 and 27 years old.  In 1987 she left work in a condiment firm in the city to take care of her children.  Since then she started buying cosmetics and blouses that she’d raffle off to earn income and help cover family expenses while tending to her home.  Gradually she started to sell assorted merchandise to her main clientele.  It was usually her former coworkers that she’d sell to on credit that they’d pay off in installments.  This is how she formed her first portfolio of customers.  She gradually added new products like shoes to have new sales lines.  In 1990 she settled in the town of Barrancas, leased an oven in a store and worked for 7 years.

When she returned to the city of Barranquilla she built her own house, bought a display case and with the money she had left over bought merchandise that she used to stock her small sales point.  She gradually became associated with firms that promote and sell products via catalogue.  She also has another income generating activity which is making and selling desserts and hayacas [type of tamal wrapped in banana leaves].  With this activity she’s managed to provide her two children with schooling and she dreams with seeing them become successful professionals.

Currently, her growing clientele is asking for more products every day and her working capital is insufficient to meet demand which is the reason why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy perfume, underwear and ingredients to make hayacas and desserts.  Her work experience, her dynamism and her determination to grow are today the reasons why her Kiva investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy perfume, underwear and ingredients to make hayacas and desserts.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis  con su credikiva compró una máquina para cortar huesos, mucha carne y mejoró el techo del expendio. Él se encuentra muy satisfecho y tiene su negocio bien ubicado en el municipio y nuevos clientes en la ciudad de Barranquilla a los que le vende a crédito; ahora esta aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, para comprar en mayor volumen y responderle efectivamente a un nuevo mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva nuevamente, con el cual comprará carnero y cerdo en volumen y aumentar sus ganancias y así mismo su capital de trabajo. “Les agradezco que me apoyaran con un primer crédito, el cual me esmeré para pagarlo puntualmente. Espero continúen apoyando para sacar adelante mi negocio y mi familia.“
texts.en:
Luis used his Kiva loan to buy a machine to cut bones, lots of meat and improved the roof on his store.  He’s very satisfied and his business is well located in the town and he has new customers in the city of Barranquilla that he sells to on credit.

He’s now applying for a new Kiva loan to buy in larger amounts to effectively respond to a new market.  This is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan again to buy veal and pork in volume to increase profits and working capital.

“Thank you for supporting me with the first loan which I strove to pay off on time.  I hope you will continue supporting me in order to move my business and my family ahead.”

loans.use: to buy veal and pork.

loans.name: Maira Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Maira, es una señora muy activa y alegre, ella  una emprendedora y se dedica a la venta de Jugos Naturales, Refrescos, Churros y otros productos de consumo diario en su casa de habitación en la aldea la cuesta, en donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de la zona, familiares, amigos.
Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años en donde a demostrado crecimiento y quien mantiene su clientela por sus años de antigüedad en el negocio.
Doña Maira esta solicitando a PRISMA de Honduras la cantidad de 7,000.00 lempiras para invertirlos en su negocio y compra mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su sueño principal es salir adelante con su familia y darles una mejor vida.



San Lorenzo, Honduras – Febrero 2012
texts.en:
Maira is a very energetic and happy woman.  She is enterprising and works selling natural juices, soft drinks, churros and other products for daily consumption from her home in the village of La Cuesta.  Her principal customers are her neighbors, family members and friends.  
She has worked at this activity for several years, and has shown an ability to grow and maintain her clientele due to the length of time she has been in business.  Maira is requesting a loan from PRISMA Honduras of 7,000.00 lempiras to invest in her business and buy more products to offer her customers.
Her main dream is to get ahead with her family and give them a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2012

loans.use: to buy soft drink, sugar and other products for her business.

loans.name: Wilson Omar

texts.es:
El joven Wilson tiene 21 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora, dedicado a su negocio actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, junto con el vive su esposa que también es comerciante, Wilson comparte con su esposa las responsabilidades en el hogar, el vive en la ciudad de Choluteca. Wilson vende sus productos en diferentes lugares de la ciudad como Monjaras, San Lorenzo, San Marcos, El Espino y diferentes barrios y colonia de esta ciudad donde reside, ya que tiene muchos clientes los cuales le hacen pedidos todas las semanas. El crédito que se le otorgo lo utilizo para la compra de controles de TV, fajas, carteras, relojes, focos, calculadoras, radios etc. el impacto que tuvo el financiamiento en su actividad es que ahora tiene una buena variedad de producto y así de esta manera sus ventas han crecido ya que puede satisfacer cada los pedidos que le hace sus clientes y atraer nuevos clientes. Los planes a futuro es comprar un carro para así poder llegara a muchos mas lugares en otras localidades.  



Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo 2012.
texts.en:
Wilson is a 21-year-old young man and very much a fighter, a person dedicated to his business, a job he has done for four years.  He lives with his wife, who is also a merchant.  Wilson shares the household responsibilities with his wife.  He lives in the city of Choluteca.

Wilson sells his products in different places in the city, such as Monjaras, San Lorenzo, San Marcos, El Espino, and different neighborhoods and communities of this city where he lives, because he has many customers who make requests every week.

He used the loan he was granted to buy television remote controls, belts, wallets, watches, flashlights, calculators, radios, etc.

The impact of the loan on his job is that now he has a good variety of products and in this way his sales have grown because he is able to satisfy all the requests his customers make of him and attract new customers.  His plan for the future is to buy a car so he will be able to get to many more places in other towns.

Choluteca, Honduras--March 2012.

loans.use: to buy belts, radios, remote controls, flashlights, calculators, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Karina Sofia

texts.es: Karina de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su única hija de 21 años de edad. Sus habilidades administrativas no se derivan de estudios especiales, sino de su aptitud para hacerlo y de su experiencia, pues durante muchos años administró negocios de un amigo, mientras este vivía en el exterior del país. Aprovechando su potencial emprendedor natural, logró ahorrar y compró una ferretería que ya tenía 3 años en el sector, pero que se había estancado, con su olfato de negocio, logró organizarla y hacerla producir, apoyada por su hija, que estudia parte del tiempo y la otra parte la dedica a su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales para construcción, pues es lo que mas consumen sus clientes y ella quiere responderles oportunamente, pues es un negocio muy bien ubicado y necesita acreditarse en toda la comunidad. El potencial exitoso de esta inversión es que con ella logra dar una respuesta efectiva a sus clientes, en un momento en el que muchos negocios no lo hacen. Así mismo el olfato de negocio de Karina muy seguramente la llevaran por el camino del progreso en compañía de su única hija que es su apoyo incondicional
texts.en:
Karina, 46, lives in the town of Malambo, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla, with her only daughter, 21.  Her administrative abilities do not come from her particular studies but from her aptitude for them and from her experience, because during many years she managed the business of a friend while he was abroad.

Taking advantage of her natural entrepreneurial potential, she managed to save and bought a hardware store that already had been in the area for three years but that had become stagnant.  With her instinct for business, she managed to organize it and make it produce, helped by her daughter, who studies part of the time and works in her business the rest of the time.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy construction materials because it is what her customers buy most.  She wants to meet their demand promptly because it is a very well located business and she needs to prove herself to the whole community.

The potential for success of this investment is that, with it, she will manage to give an effective response to her customers at a time in which many businesses do not do this.  Also, Karina's instinct for business certainly will take her on the road to progress in the company of her only daughter, who is her unconditional support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Faed

texts.en:
Faed is a 33-year-old married man living in Sana'a. He is characterized as being very hardworking and he always wants to offer his family a good quality of life. Faed is the father of two children who are his motivation for making an effort in his work every day. He worked in his friend's salon as a barber for a couple of years in order to feed his family. Then he started his independent business a year ago and called two of his friends to work with him. 

Faed makes enough income to cover the costs of his home. Due to the good quality of his products and the good service that he offers, he has a large number of customers to the point that he currently cannot satisfy all the demand for his business. With the intention of satisfying all of his customers, Faed is looking for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB to purchase more chairs, mirrors and shaving cream, enabling him to meet all of the demand for his business.

Faed hopes to expand his business and attract new clients. He also hopes to open another salon on another street and make it possible for other free young people to work.

loans.use: to purchase more chairs, mirrors and shaving cream

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en:
Fedaa is a 42-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Fedaa has a homebased project selling clothes.

Fedaa is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 35-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Ghada has a shop where she sells cosmetic products. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more cosmetics for trading purposes.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 42-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Abeer is a tailor with a home-based workshop. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase fabrics and thread for her business.

Abeer is looking to have her own workshop away from her home with an aspiration of purchasing a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and thread

loans.name: Zikrullo

texts.ru: Зикрулло проживает в городе Дангара. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается животноводством. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Zikrullo lives in the city of Dangara.  He is 33 years old, married and has three children.  He is involved in animal husbandry.  Zikrullo has been in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Otabek

texts.ru: Отабек 1981 года рождения,он женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Отабек живет с родителями.Он вмести с отцом занимается разведением скота.Когда Отабек был еще мальчиком, отец научил его этому ремеслу,. У них есть козы, которых они стригут,  а шерсть после обработки выставляют на продажу. Посоветовавшись с отцом,он только потом решил получить у нас кредит. Кредит ему необходим для увеличение поголовья скота, в дальнейшем скот будет разводить легче, так как появиться трава и другие кормовые культуры.
texts.en: Otabek was born 1981.  He is married and has one child.  Otabek lives with his parents.  Together with his father, he is involved in breeding livestock.  When Otabek was still a boy, his father taught him this trade.  They have goats, which they shear and sell the fur after processing it.  After seeking advice form his father, he only then decided to obtain a loan from us.  Otabek needs the loan to increase his livestock headcount.  In the future, it would be easier to breed livestock because there will be grass and other feed crops.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Santa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Santa, es una persona emprendedora, responsable ella vive en una comunidad en el sur de Honduras, ella se dedica a la venta de leña, negocio que ha tenido desde hace varios años en el cual atiende a todos sus familiares, vecinos y amigos que hacen uso de su producto día con día. Doña Santa esta solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en compra de leña para atender a sus clientes con mejor y mas producto.
Doña Santa esta solicitando a PRISMA de Honduras la cantidad de 7,000.00 lempiras para invertirlos en su negocio a un plazo de 8 meses.
Su sueño principal es sacar a su familia adelante para tener mejores condiciones de vida.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – Febrero 2012
texts.en:
Santa is an enterprising, responsible person.  She lives in a community in southern Honduras.  She sells firewood for a living and she has had this business for several years now.  She serves all of her family members, neighbors, and friends, who use her product every day.  Santa is asking for a loan to buy firewood to better serve her customers with more product.  

Santa is asking Prisma Honduras for the amount of 7,000 lempiras to invest in her business for an eight-month term.

Her main dream is to get her family ahead to have better living conditions.

San Lorenza, Honduras -- February 2012

loans.use: to buy firewood for her business

loans.name: Jumabubu

texts.ru: Жумабубу 63 года, вдова, воспитала 9 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Жумабубу  в 1997 году начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 10,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Жумабубу, ее поголовье насчитывает  5 дойных коров и 35 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумабубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Жумабубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, чтобы в будущем открыть свою миниферму.
texts.en: Jumabubu is 63 years old, a widow and raised nine children.  To provide a source of income for her family, Jumabubu became involved in animal husbandry in 1997.  The business, started with 10,000 som (KGS), today yields about 12,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk and meat products.  Thanks to Jumabubu's hard work, her livestock headcount includes five dairy cows and thirty-five sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Jumabubu requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of livestock headcount in order to open her own mini-farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Arina

texts.ru: Арина очень активная и умная женщина, она очень любит свою дочь и внука. Она живет одна, дочь находиться в другом городе со своим мужем и сыном, но время от времени приезжает навещать Арину.  Раньше Арина заведовала магазином, со временем  она начала реализовать свой товар. Теперь у нее большой ассортимента товара. Она оптом торгует приправами и другими продуктами питания. С нашей организацией сотрудничает с 2007 года. На рынке работает около 6 лет. Арина очень благодарна Арванд, она рада что существуют такие организации которые могут ее поддерживать.
texts.en: Arina is a very active and smart woman.  She loves her daughter and grandson very much.  She lives alone.  Her daughter is another city with her husband and son, but comes to visit Arina from time to time.  Previously, Arina managed a store and with time started to sells her own merchandise.  Now, she has a large assortment of goods.  She sells spices and other food products wholesale.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2007.  She has been working at the market for about six years.  Arina is very grateful to Arvand and happy that such organizations that can support her exist.

loans.use: to expand a selection of goods

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан житель города Истаравшан. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Хасан занимается купле – продажей одежды. В этой области она десять лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения сезонного товара с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Hasan is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 35 years old, married and has two children.  Hasan is involved in buying and selling clothing.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to buy seasonal merchandise in order to expand the selection of goods.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она занимается купле- продажей детской и подростковой  одежды, а также обуви. Она в этой сфере бизнесе уже более 21 лет и имеет богатый опыт. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки летней обуви с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Matluba is a hardworking and kind woman.  She is married and a loving mother of three children.  She is involved in buying and selling children's and teenage clothing and also shoes.  Matluba has been in this business for over 21 years and a rich experience in it.  She wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to buy summer shoes in order to expand her business.  She relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy summer shoes

loans.name: Kyzjibek

texts.ru: Кызжибек 63 года, вдова, воспитала 6 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Кызжибек  в 1991 году начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с покупки одной овцематки хозяйство  на сегодня насчитывает  1 дойную корову и 10 овец. Также Кызжибек обрабатывает 3,2 га земли, где выращивает фасоль и пшеницу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кызжибек обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Кызжибек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, чтобы в будущем расширить бизнес – деятельность за счет открытия магазина продуктов.
texts.en: Kyzjibek is 63 years old, a widow and raised six children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 1991.  The sheep business, started with a purchase of one ewe, today contains one dairy cow and ten sheep.  Kyzjibek also works on 3.2 hectares of land, where she grows beans and wheat.  In order to further develop her business, Kyzjibek requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of livestock headcount, so that she could further expand her business in the future by opening a food store.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sharifakhon

texts.ru: Шарифахон трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина, которая замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Её муж занимается производством тандыров. Более 16 лет Шарифахон занимается купле- продажей обуви и детской одежды. Её торговая точка находится в центре города. Шарифахон хотела бы получить займ для покупки сезонной одежды. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Sharifakhon is a hardworking and conscientious woman, who is married and a loving mother of four children.  Her husband is involved in manufacturing of tandoor ovens.  Sharifakhon has been involved in buying and selling shoes and children's clothing for over 16 years.  Her retail outlet is located in the city center.  Sharifakhon wants to obtain this loan to buy seasonal clothing.  She relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Aneta needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to expand the business.

Aneta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Aneta's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise bananas

loans.name: Lusila

texts.en:
Lusila is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting cocoa for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Lusila needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to continue improving her land.

In 2011, Lusila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lusila's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for growing cocoa

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 53 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se dedica a la venta de mercancías mediante pedidos.  Julia es una mujer casada y tienen un hijo de 22 años de edad, con el cual sueña verlo convertido en una persona exitosa. Desde hace 3 años ahorró de la mesada que le suministra su hijo y emprendió sus propias aventuras de negocio, pues necesitaba sentirse productiva y apoyar la económica de su hogar. Así fue como empezó a comprar sobrecamas, toallas, que vendió a crédito inicialmente entre familiares y amigos, con su negocio le ha ido muy bien, pero tiene muchos deseos de crecer y su mayor desafío para lograrlo es tener un capital de trabajo suficiente para comprar y ampliar su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará edredones, toallas, sandalias, que han sido solicitadas por sus clientes, lo cual hace que esta inversión se potencialice como exitosa.
texts.en:
Julia is 53 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla, where she makes a living selling goods through customer orders. She is married and has a 22 year old son who she hopes will become a successful person. 

Three years ago she saved enough from the stand that her son supplies and started her own business adventure because she needed to feel productive and to financially support her home. This was how she began to purchase bed quilts and towels which she initially sold on credit to friends and relatives. 

Julia has done very well with her business but she hopes for it to grow. The biggest challenge to expanding her business is having enough capital for purchasing and broadening her customer base. This is why she is asking for a loan, which is the first funding that she is requesting from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will purchase quilts, towels, and sandals that her customers have asked for, and thus her investment will become successful.

loans.use: to purchase quilts, towels, and sandals.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 40 años de edad  es un hombre casado y padre de 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 11 años de edad, que vive al sur de la ciudad y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de suero y crema de leche, la cual vende al por mayor y al detal. Desde el departamento del Magdalena le viene la materia prima para su trabajo, que es la masa que el licua, mezcla y envasa, en recipientes plásticos hasta de un litro para el suero y de una libra para la crema de leche.  Sus principales clientes, son vecinos, amigos e intermediarios, como tiendas, vendedores ambulantes y panaderías,  que se acercan diariamente a realizar su compra al por mayor y al detal y con el dinero en la mano, como lo hace la gran mayoría de clientes. Su mayor fortaleza es el manejo de precios alcanzables para sus compradores y la calidad de sus productos. Su negocio lo desarrolla con su cuñada quien es su socia y ambos tienen muchos sueños de crecimiento empresarial. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado, masa de suero, para incrementar la producción y la venta de sus dos productos estrellas: El suero y la crema de leche. Su meta es lograr un mayor volumen de sus ventas a crédito y en mayor volumen para aumentar sus clientela y con ello las utilidades del negocio, que lo ayudan a aumentar el bienestar de su familia..
texts.en: Forty-year-old Julio is a married man and the father of two children who are nine and eleven years old.  He lives in the southern part of the city and he makes and sells whey and whey cream for a living, which he sells wholesale and retail.  The raw material for his work comes from the department of Magdalena.  This is the mixture he liquefies, mixes, and bottles in one-liter plastic containers for the whey and one-pound plastic containers for the whey cream.  His main customers are his neighbors, friends, and middlemen, such as stores, street vendors, and bakeries, who come by daily to make their wholesale and retail purchases with money in hand, as the vast majority of his customers do.  His greatest strength is his ability to maintain prices that are affordable for his buyers and the quality of his products.  He works in his business with his sister-in-law, who is his partner, and they both have many dreams of growing their business.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which will be his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy whey starter to increase production and sales of his two star products, whey and whey cream.  His goal is to have higher sales on credit and to sell in greater quantities to increase his clientele and, with that, to increase his business's profits, which help him improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy whey starter wholesale and in cash

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is 53 years old and married with 3 children. She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taamu (giant taro) for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Beauty needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Beauty joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Beauty's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Moli

texts.en:
Moli is 20 years old and married with 2 children. She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Moli needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 300 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2012, Moli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Moli's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers to start a vegetable garden

loans.name: Sonadores Con Proposito 6 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group "Soñadores con Proposito" (Dreamer with a purpose) 6. This group is located in the city of El Seybo, one of the most agricultural and rural cities in the Dominican Republic. The borrowers run their businesses in the communities near the city. They sell clothes, shoes, grocery store items and others.

Margarita makes her home here in a simple house with her long-term partner and four children. She is a devoted mother. She is running a clothing store where she sells all kinds of men's, kid's and women's clothes. She will use this loan to increase her inventory by buying more clothes, specially for the summer season. She is excited to be taking out her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanded her business and she uses the profits to reinvest in her business and to save. Her future plan is to expand her clothing store with more products like cosmetics and accessories. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Wendy

texts.es: Wendy tiene 31 años de edad y vive al sur de la ciudad con sus tres hijos, en las edades de 5 a 13 años. Su idea de negocio nació desde que terminó su bachillerato y estudió en una academia para ser estilista de belleza, su experiencia la recibió trabajando para una peluquería durante 10 años, donde desarrolló todas sus habilidades, para finalmente dedicarse a este oficio, desde la casa paterna donde habita con sus hijos. Su meta es tener varias peluquerías abiertas en diversos sitios de la ciudad, pero su capital de trabajo es su mayor desafío para lograrlo. En su negocio tiene una clientela que la reconoce en sus capacidades técnicas y porque es una persona con vocación de servicio, por eso aunque la competencia es otro de sus desafíos, la enfrenta con buenos precios a sus clientes y ofreciéndoles como servicio el mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará insumos de peluquería,  como productos capilares y de aseo personal, que también están abriéndose paso en su mercado de clientes, siempre que ella los asesora y es por esto que los vende también, desde su salón de belleza y esto es justamente la razón del éxito que muy probablemente tendrá su inversión .
texts.en: Wendy is 31 years old and she lives in the southern part of the city with her three children, who range from five to thirteen years old.  Her idea for her business came about when she graduated from high school and she attended a cosmetology academy.  She gained her experience working in a hair salon for ten years, where she developed all of her abilities so that she could finally dedicate herself to this profession working out of her parents' home, where she lives with her children.  Her goal is to have several hair salons open in different areas of the city, but her working capital is her biggest challenge to achieving it.  The clientele she has at her business recognizes her technical abilities and, because she is a person with a vocation for service, she faces the challenge of competition with good prices for her customers and by offering them the service of improving their personal and professional images.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which will be her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy hair salon supplies, such as hair products and beauty products, which are also becoming more popular with her customers, as she gives them consultations.  That is why she sells them in her beauty salon as well and this is the exact reason her investment will probably be successful.

loans.use: to buy hair salon supplies, such as hair products and beauty products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 27 años de edad,  se dedica al comercio de artículos decorativos en madera Country. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se independizó de su familia a muy temprana edad, arrendó un apartamento y se fue a vivir sola; inicialmente trabajaba  como profesora de un jardín y hacia refuerzos a niños que tenían problemas de aprendizaje o requerían les apoyara  en dar respuesta a sus tareas  educativas. Una vez se interesó en aprender el oficio artesanal de decoración en madera,  dio rienda suelta a su creatividad y emprendió su propia aventura de negocios y desde entonces decora todo lo que, portarretratos, llaveros etc. Su clientela está conformada por familiares, vecinos y amigos, y también personas que estos le han referenciado. Hace mas de un año se dedica a la decoración de madera y esta se le ha convertido en una actividad que le apasiona y la disfruta,  mientras con ella  genera sus propios  ingresos. En sus sueños de crecimiento, está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará cuadros de madera, portarretratos, cofres, llaveros, pintura y recinas, para aplicarle su tecina de decoración, de la cual se siente orgullosa y la hace sentir libre
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old and sells decorative wooden products. She is a young entrepreneur who became independent from her family at a very young age when she rented an apartment and went to live alone. At first she worked as a preschool teacher and helped children with learning disabilities and those who needed help with their schoolwork. 

Once she became interested in learning the art of wooden decorations, she found an outlet for her creativity and started her own business adventure. Since then she decorates everything from picture frames to key chains, etc. Her customers are relatives, neighbors, and friends, as well as people who have been referred to her. 

Maria has been decorating wooden products for more than a year. This activity has become her passion and something that she enjoys, and with it she earns her income. In the hopes of growing her business, Maria is requesting this loan, her first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will purchase wooden boxes, picture frames, boxes, key chains, paint, and resins. She will apply her touch of decoration, which makes her feel proud and free.

loans.use: to purchase wooden boxes, picture frames, boxes, key chains, paint, and resins.

loans.name: Puna

texts.en:
Puna is 36 years old and married with five children. She is starting a business venture, growing and harvesting a variety of crops for sale. Puna needs a loan of 1,000 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas per week) to continue improving her land.

In 2012, Puna joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Puna's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers, such as Gramoxome, to help her crops grow.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда живет в Дрогобыче. Она торгует носками, колготками, перчатками, боксерками и тапками на одном из местных рынков. Ее торговая точка расположена в проходе на рынок, где проходит весь поток потенциальных клиентов. Этим видом предпринимательской деятельности Надежда занимается уже 12 лет. Товара у нее на данный момент – на сумму в 10 000 гривен. 

На данный момент бизнес Надежды не особенно развит, но, тем не менее, дает стабильную прибыль для нее и ее семьи. Надежда надеется использовать кредит для того, чтобы увеличить количество весеннего ассортимента товара. Более разнообразный выбор товара привлечет клиентов, и Надежда сможет заработать больше за счет более быстрого товарооборота. Мелочи и недорогие товары, которые реализует Надежда, хорошо продаются и пользуются широким спросом. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Nadezhda lives in Drogobych.  She sells socks, stockings, gloves, tank tops and slippers at one of the local markets.  Her retail outlet is located at the walkway to the market, where all of the potential clients pass through.  Nadezhda has been involved in this entrepreneurship for 12 years.  She currently has merchandise valued at 10,000 hryvnia.  Currently, Nadezhda's business is not very developed, but despite that, it provides a stable income for her and her family.  Nadezhda hopes to use the loan to expand the inventory of spring merchandise selection.  A more varied choice of merchandise attracts customers, and Nadezhda would be able to earn more due to a quicker goods turnover.  Small things and inexpensive goods that Nadezhda sells sell well and are in high demand.

loans.use: to expand the inventory of spring merchandise

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Более 6 лет Мухарам занимается купле- продажей обуви и детской одежды. Она замужняя женщина и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Мухарам имеет богатый опыт, а также много постоянных клиентов. Её торговая точка находится на центральном рынке. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес для того чтобы немножко улучшить свои жилищные условия. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки товара на предстоящий сезон. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: For more then 6 years Muharam has been selling shoes and children's clothes on the local market. She is a married woman and is raising three children. Muharam has a lot of experience in sales and has many regular clients. Her market stall is located at the central city market. She wants to expand her business so that she can improve her family's living conditions a little. With this goal in mind Muharam has requested a loan of 2000 somoni to purchase merchandise for the upcoming spring season. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy a merchandise

loans.name: Rajamo

texts.ru: Рачамо занимается производством хлопкового масла. В этой области она пять лет. Ей 58 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Рачамо берет кредит для покупки семян хлопчатника.
texts.en: Rajamo produces cotton seed oil. She has had her oil pressing business for five years. Rajamo is 58 years old, married and a mother of six children. She is taking out this loan to purchase cotton seeds in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase cotton seeds

loans.name: Utuie

texts.en:
Utuie is 42 years old and married with two children. She is starting a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. Utuie needs a loan of 1,000 Samoa tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or about US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2012, Utuie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Utuie's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина с мужем и сыном-подростком живет в Каменке. Она занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в тепличных условиях для последующей их реализации на рынках города. Ирина имеет большой участок земли. У нее есть три большие теплицы, а также две теплицы для рассады. Выращиванием овощей она занимается уже 3 года. В хозяйство вложено около 150 000 гривен. Затраты на семена и пленку ежегодно составляют 27 000 гривен. 

Ирина планирует вложить полученные от КИВА заемные средства в установку отопительной системы в своих теплицах. Для того, чтобы закупить необходимые шланги, насосы и крепления потребуется сумма в 12 000 гривен. Недавно Ирина купила котел за 18 000 гривен, теперь необходимо приобрести все остальные детали и провести отопление во всех теплицах, что она планировала сделать уже давно. В этом году Ирина вложила все имеющиеся у нее средства в отопление, а в следующем надеется сделать ремонт в доме. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Irina lives with her husband and son in the city of Kamenka. She grows early vegetables in greenhouses for sale at city markets. Irina owns a large plot of land and has been farming for three years. She has three big greenhouses and also two greenhouses for seedlings. Her farm is worth 150,000 griven now and she spends 27,000 griven yearly to purchase seeds and plastic foil.

Irina is planning to use the loan from Kiva to install a heating system in her greenhouses. She needs 12,000 griven so that she can buy the necessary pumps, tubing and holders. Recently Irina used 18,000 griven to purchase a water heater and now she needs this loan to purchase the rest of the supplies and install the heating systems in her greenhouses as she has been planning to do for a long time. This year Irina has invested all of her money into this project but in the future she is hoping to use some of the profits to repair her family home.

loans.use: to install heating system in greenhouses

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр с женой и двумя взрослыми детьми живет в селе Благовещенка. Он уже 20 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, выращивая ранние овощи в тепличных условиях на продажу. Александр владеет большим участком земли, на которых он поставил уже 3 теплицы, а также одну под рассаду. В хозяйство у него вложено 40 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют около 21 000 гривен. 

Александр планирует вложить кредит КИВА в размере 15 000 гривен в подготовку к новому фермерскому сезону: он сможет закупить пленку на 7 000 гривен, семена на 5 000 гривен и навоз в качестве удобрений на 3 000 гривен. Александр делает ставку на развитие, хочет со временем сделать полный ремонт в доме, который они не так давно приобрели.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alexander, his wife and their two adult children live in the village of Blagoveschenka. Alexander has been farming for 20 years, he grows early vegetables for the city markets. He owns a large plot of land where he has three greenhouses, as well as a small greenhouse for seedlings. He has invested 40,000 griven into his farm and he spends 21,000 griven yearly for seeds and plastic foil.

Alexander is planning to use the 15,000 griven KIVA loan to get ready for the farming season: he will be able to buy plastic foil for 7,000 griven, seeds for 5,000 griven and manure for fertilizing for 3,000 griven. Alexander is planning to develop his business in the future since he needs more profits in order to repair his newly purchased house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and plastic foil

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es: Emperatriz  de 43 años, se dedica a la venta de queso y carne de res en el municipio de Soledad,  a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos,  en las edades de 11 a 23 años.  En el año 1987 se inició vendiéndole queso a una tienda en el municipio de San Antonio, y con lo bien que le fue, generó sus propios ingresos.  Por eso cuando su familia se trasladó a la ciudad de Barranquilla en el año 1992, inició esta misma actividad entre sus vecinos, y fue construyendo su clientela con tiendas y negocios de alimentos, que aun le compran. Últimamente ha incorporado a su negocio carne de res y con este negocio tiene un nuevo mercado, construido desde la clientela que le compra el queso, que trae desde el departamento del Magdalena. Su sueño es adquirir una vivienda propia, por eso todos los días trabaja para   lograrlo. Su negocio ha crecido y su potencial de clientes también, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará queso y carne en mayor cantidad, con ello el volumen de ventas se incrementará y así mismo sus utilidades; su proyecto de inversión se visiona como exitoso,  porque está basado no solo en su experiencia,  sino también en una clientela que desde ya,  ha hecho sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is 43 years old and sells cheese and beef in the community of Soledad, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. She lives there with her husband and three children ages 11 to 23. 

In 1987 Emperatriz began to sell cheese to a store in the community of San Antonio and it went so well that she generated her own income. Because of this, when her family moved to Barranquilla in 1992, she began this same activity among her neighbors. Over time she built her customer base with stores and grocers that still buy from her today. 

Recently Emperatriz has been incorporating beef into her business. This has opened to her a new market based on the customers that purchase cheese from her, which she brings from the region of Magdalena. Her dream is to acquire her own dwelling and she works every day to achieve this. 

Her business and potential for customers have grown so Emperatriz is requesting this loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan she will purchase cheese and meat in bulk, which will increase her volume of sales and thus increase her profits. She envisions her investment project as successful because it is based not only on her experience, but also on a customer base that as of now has already made requests.

loans.use: to purchase cheese and meat in bulk.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania de 41 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 a 16 años. Ella es una ama de casa que trabajó varios años en una casa de eventos y al retirarse decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios,  comercializando cuadros y adornos en madera,  que le envían desde Medellín, sus productos los vende a crédito para recibir pagos en un plazo de 2  a 3 meses. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer crédkiva,  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancías, entre cuadros y adornos de maderas, para responder a sus pedidos, pues últimamente su clientela se ha incrementado y responder a ellos se convierte en todo un desafío. Su mercado está ubicado en el estrato socioeconómico medio, pues los productos se consideran suntuosos, pero gustan mucho entre los clientes que tienen la capacidad de compra. Su meta es continuar ampliando su negocio y a futuro abrir un local al público. Mientras esto ocurre maneja un margen de utilidad no menor del 40% y una rotación de inventarios no mayor a 10  días.
texts.en: Forty-one-year-old Tania lives in the city of Baranquilla with her husband and her two children, who are 12 and 16 years old.  She is a housewife who worked at an event hall for several years and when she left she decided to start her own business venture selling paintings and wooden decorative pieces.  She receives her products from Medellín and sells them on credit, receiving payments over periods of two or three months.  She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy merchandise such as paintings and wooden decorative pieces to fill her orders, as lately her clientele has increased and keeping up has become a challenge.  Her market is in the mid-socioeconomic strata, as her products are considered to be luxuries, but they are very popular among the customers who can afford them.  Her goal is to keep expanding her business and, in the future, to open a space to the public.  While working towards this, she has maintains a profit margin of no less than 40% and an inventory turnover of no more than 10 days.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as paintings and wooden decorative pieces

loans.name: Taliilagi

texts.en:
Taliilagi is 27 years old and married with two children. She sells baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.    

Taliilagi needs a loan of 1,500 Samoa tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 tala per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Taliilagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Taliilagi's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is 21 years old and married with three children. She sells baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.    

Elisabeth needs a loan of 1,500 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or about US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Elisabeth joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Elisabeth's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Faataualofa

texts.en:
Faataualofa is 32 years old and married with three children. She plants and harvests bananas for sale. She has two years of experience in this business.    Faataualofa needs a loan of 1,500 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Faataualofa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Faataualofa's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment to grow bananas.

loans.name: Sape

texts.en:
Sape is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.   

Sape needs a loan of 1,500 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas or about US $146 per week) to continue improving the business.

In 2011, Sape joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sape's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make baked goods.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора честная и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Муж находится в трудовой миграции  в  Российской Федерации. Более 5 лет она занимается купле- продажей мужской одежды. Она торгует на центральном рынке. Она начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. Гулнора хотела бы получить займ для приобретения летней одежды. Она надеется на вашу поддержку и великодушие.
texts.en: Gulnora is an honest and kind woman. She is married and a loving mother of four children. Gulnora's husband is a migrant worker in Russia. She herself sells men's clothes and has been managing her central market stall for five years. When she started, Gulnora used to sell children clothes. She would like to take out a loan to purchase summer clothes for sale. Gulnora hopes for your support and charity.

loans.use: To buy new clothing

loans.name: Asunción  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Asunción está formado por 5 socias y 2 socios quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, siendo la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es reconocida como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, cuenta con una  variada gastronomía, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Nuestras socias son personas amables y gentiles, quienes laboran día a día en sus diferentes ocupaciones las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Ana, tiene de 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá labora en un taller de carpintería de su propiedad en el cual fabrican toda clase de muebles, puertas y ventanas, y su mamá es empleada privada. La casa en la que vive de propiedad de sus padres.

La Señorita. Ana labora en el negocio de su padre, actividad que ha iniciado a desempeñar hace 6 meses, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en madera para el negocio de su padre. 

Su meta es agrandar el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
