The Asunción Communal Bank is made up of five female members and two male members who live in different areas of the city of Cuenca.  This city is the capital of the province of Azuay and it is the third most important city in the country.  It has been recognized as a World Heritage Site since December 1999.  It has a varied gastronomy and its people maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Our members are nice and kind people who work day after day at their different occupations, which allow them to cover their household expenses and offer their children a better future.

One of the group's members is Ana.  She is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  Her dad works in a carpenter's workshop that he owns, where he makes all kinds of furniture, doors, and windows, and her mom is a private employee.  The house she lives in belongs to her parents.

Ana works at her father's business, which she has done for six months now.  She works from Monday to Saturday without a set schedule.

This is her second loan with her communal bank and she will use it to buy wood for her father's business.

Her goal is to expand the family business.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Maatane

texts.en:
Maatane is thirty-one years old and single with four children. She runs a small business, making and selling handicrafts to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Maatane requested a loan to purchase materials needed to make her handicrafts. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family and continue improving her business. 

Maatane joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. This is her first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en:
Loimata is fifty-nine years old and married with two children. She runs a small business venture, making and selling a variety of snacks and food products. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Loimata requested a loan to purchase ingredients required to make the snacks and goods for sale. She will use the profits to support her family and continue improving her business.

Loimata joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. This is her first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make products to sell.

loans.name: Merenciana

texts.en:
Merenciana is from Pantaon Ozamiz City. She is sixty-one years old. Merenciana is married and has three children. To make a living, Merenciana raises crops, planting and harvesting bananas to sell. Merenciana has been in her business for eleven years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Merenciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merenciana is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn is a married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is responsible for a small young kid who completely depends on her care. Soeurn is involved in agribusiness during the rainy season but she also acts as a chef serving foods for a large group of people, particularly the ones who come for special ceremonies like wedding parties, birthday parties as well as funeral ceremonies. She has her own team to provide this type of service around the province or distant areas outside the province.  Another main source of income is from her husband who works at the construction field. He’s a construction foreman who leads a small group of men to perform particular jobs.

Presently, her family is experiencing difficulties in daily activities and businesses due to the lack of a proper vehicle for traveling. For this reason, Soeurn would like to acquire a loan through HKL, a partner of Kiva, to purchase a used motorcycle to provide good transportation for the entire family. Soeurn hopes to provide her family happiness and a comfortable situation through her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle to provide good transportation for the entire family.

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy, age thirty-two, is a humble villager who lives with her spouse and three school-age children in Kompot province, Cambodia. Koy really enjoys her life being an honest rice cultivator there. She said that it’s the only business from which the family can generate a daily living. She prefers growing rice to other crops because rice produces a good result and helps the family to meet its daily needs. She is not concerned about operating this kind of business since her spouse is very supportive and works beside her. 

As of now, Koy is taking out for a loan from HKL and Kiva to rebuild a nice kitchen and build a toilet to ensure a healthier family. She has planed to do it for a few years, and now she can make this plan reality through the valued loan from our kind lenders.

loans.use: to rebuild a nice kitchen and build a toilet to ensure a healthier family.

loans.name: Simoneides

texts.en:
Simoneides is from Centro Napo Tudela, Misamis Occodental. She is thirty-three years old and single. To make a living, Simoneides owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a parlor. 

Simoneides has been engaged in her business for twelve years and earns  8,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Simoneides joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simoneides is requesting a loan of 16,600 PHP which will be used to purchase cosmetics, shampoo, etc for her parlor. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, shampoo and other products for her parlor.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is from Sebasi Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is forty-nine years old. Ricardo is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Ricardo operates a motorcycle transport service. Ricardo has been engaged in his business for eleven years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Ricardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. 

Ricardo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his vehicle so it can give a better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle so it can give better service.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store business where she sells items like canned goods, rice, noodles and spices. Aurea is able to contribute to her family's earnings with her income from the store.

Aurea is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to buy two sacks of rice and canned goods to sell. This loan will help increase Aurea's profitability. Aurea hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Plan

texts.en:
Plan is a loving mother who is responsible for, and looks after, four children. They live in Baray district of Siem Reap province.

To pursue a standard of living and provide her children with a good education, Plan operates a fish selling business in a local market of the province. She sells various kinds of fish including fresh fish, dry fish, smoked fish and paste-fermented fish, earning approximately USD 3.50 per day. Plan’s husband is a supporter of this business. He normally catches fish from the river for Plan every day.

With the requested amount of USD 1,500, Plan will buy construction supplies so that she can finish the building works on her present house. She has already hired local skilled people to do the construction. This is her second loan cycle loan from our firm, HKL. She is confident she will pay her loan back to our funders as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to finish the construction work on her house.

loans.name: Preas

texts.en:
Preas is a nineteen-year-old married woman who resides in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. She, together with her husband, earns a living in a fair way by dedicating their time to rice husbandry. She has been in this business since 2005. She has now become a young mother of two children. 

At present, Preas is seeking a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to supplement her savings so that she can build a suitable house to live in independently. It’ll be a great support to Preas to help her attain her dream of having a nice comfortable house in the province. 

In the future, Preas wants to buy extra farmland to expand her farming productivity in a satisfactory manner.

loans.use: to build a suitable house to live in independently.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng is a married woman and has three children attending public state school. She lives with her husband and the children in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. Leng has spent most of her life cultivating crops for a livelihood. She grows rice, potatoes and vegetables on her own farm depending on the season of the year. She always has her children assist her in the maintenance at the rice field when they are free from school. Her husband shares his responsibility for the family by working as a soldier for government, receiving his payment monthly.

Now Leng decided to ask for her first loan, a sum of USD 500, which she will use to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to better her living situation and avoid having to take motor-taxi services. Leng intends to save money to develop her agribusiness in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to better her living situation and avoid having to take motor-taxi services.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a forty-nine-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has two children aged seventeen and twenty-one. Delia and her husband are both farmers. They cultivate their land to grow rice crops to sell. Delia's husband mainly manages their farm. Delia, on the other hand, does her best to contribute to her family's earnings. She runs a sari-sari store business located just at the front of their house. She sells various items like sugar, coffee, canned goods and toiletries.

Delia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. This will help increase Delia's business profitability. Delia plans to use her extra income to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Te

texts.en:
Te, thirty-three, lives in Dongkor commune, a suburb area of Phnom Penh city, with her life partner and two school-age school. Te owns small store selling many types of products to local people around her neighborhood. She sells sweet things, snacks, groceries and household materials as well. She typically generates in the neighborhood of USD 6.00 per day through this business activity.

Te has come to HKL for the second time to borrow some funds to purchase a stock of merchandise to sustain her business and make it stable. Without any funds from our lenders, Te will experience financial difficulties and won’t be able to continually run her business well.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married. Marcelina is forty-nine years old, residing in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marcelina owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products such as vegetables, snack items etc to earn a living. She's been eight years in this business, and each month, she earns PHP 3,000 from it. 

She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more vegetables and snack items to sell. 

In 2008, Marcelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Marcelina wants to make business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and snack items to sell.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a fifty-five-year-old married man who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. Ernesto has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business. He earns 5,000 PHP per month with this business. Ernesto works hard to provide for his family's needs and send his children to school. 

He requested a loan to purchase more gasoline and spare parts. Ernesto hopes to expand his business and purchase an additional motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and spare parts.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is a married with two children. She is twenty-eight years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Elvina owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Elvina has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for four years. In the future, Elvina's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a house and lot.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Felipa earns a living through running a sari-sari store business. She sells various items like canned goods, toiletries and soft drinks. She also sells gasoline and coconut wine. Felipa is happy to contribute to her family's earnings. She does her best to support her family: her husband and eight children. Felipa's husband is a farmer and she helps him sells his produce at the market.

Felipa is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, toiletries and gasoline. Felipa hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, toiletries and gasoline.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is seventy years old. Bonifacia is widow and has four children. To make a living, Bonifacia owns and operates a business venture selling barbequed food. Bonifacia has been in her business for four years and earns 4,300 PHP a month for these activities. Bonifacia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more chicken, hot dogs and other products to sell. 

In 2007, Bonifacia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and hot dogs to sell.

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.en:
Wenceslao is sixty-four years old, a widower with three children. He is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where his rice production is located. He was just twenty-five years old when he started cultivating this land. That was quite long ago but he never ceases because his passion for doing so urges him to go on working. At the end of the month, Wenceslao gets PHP 10,000, which he divides equally among his family. 

Wenceslao joined GDMPC to access financial services offered by the cooperative. He has borrowed PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer such as manure. He hopes to plant sooner so as not to waste time. Wenceslao plans to apply appropriate fertilizers and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Mol

texts.en:
Mol, age fifty-seven, is a married woman and has three single children attending public schools. She resides in Dongkor commune, Phnom Penh city. To generate income to support her family, Mol makes and sells Khmer cakes from a rented booth in a junior high school. She is able to yield approximately USD 3.33 per day from this type of business.

So now, Mol would like to acquire her first loan. She will add it to her existing capital and buy household products to improve her standard of living. Mol hopes that this loan will be granted to her to develop her living conditions. She is very thankful for the great support to her family.

loans.use: to add to her existing capital to buy household products to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Nim is aged forty-seven. She is a married woman who has been blessed with four children, two of whom now are employed in various careers in Phnom Penh city. She currently lives with her husband and two unemployed children in Reussey Keo commune. Nim describes herself a humble farmer who owns only a few pieces of fertile land for farming. However, she is industrious in her business of cultivating rice in order to ensure a further education of her children. Nim has a life partner in her spouse who serves the people with his construction business.  

Nim is asking for her first loan from HKL to pay the fees of the construction workers who are fixing her house. This funding will provide her family a suitable and comfortable house. She is very happy and appreciates the great support from our generous lenders.

loans.use: to pay fees for the construction workers to fix her house.

loans.name: Choun

texts.en:
Choun is forty-three years old and is married with four single children. She permanently resides in Reussey Keo commune, where most Cambodian-Islamic people prefer to live. Choun works for a garment factory located not so far away from her house. Her schedule is from 7am to 5pm. But sometimes she has to work overtime to make extra money to meet her daily needs. In addition to this work, Choun owns a small general store in her home where she sells a variety of products to serve the people in her neighborhood. 

At this time, Choun is experiencing financial difficulties. Her present stock of merchandise has gradually run out. In order to make a stable business, Choun would like to acquire some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy merchandise to replenish her stock. With the increase in income, Choun will be able to save some of it to improve her business in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to replenish her stock.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is fifty years old and married with fourteen children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Fannie

texts.en:
Fannie is sixty-seven years old and married.

Fannie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Fannie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fannie has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed eighteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fannie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gracilla

texts.en:
Gracilla is forty-seven years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Gracilla is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Gracilla has been raising livestock for one year and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (general) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is forty-nine years old and married with four children.

Ma. Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Ma. Victoria has borrowed and paid for six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Ma. Victoria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mayonita

texts.en:
Mayonita is sixty-one years old and married with four children.

Mayonita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Mayonita has borrowed and paid for seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for twelve years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Mayonita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is fifty-three years old and married with six children.

Pilar works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Pilar has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Pilar aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Renebeth

texts.en:
Renebeth is thirty-seven years old and married with one child.

Renebeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Renebeth has borrowed and paid for two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling firewood.

Renebeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is thirty-two years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, soap, sugar, milk, spices, etc.

In the future Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Teresita has been in this business for ten years. Teresita earns more income from a general store, raising livestock and selling water.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is sixty years old and married with seven children.

Florida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Florida has borrowed and paid for twenty-one loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Florida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Juraita

texts.en:
Juraita is fifty-two years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Juraita works very hard to provide for them.

Juraita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Juraita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as spices, eggs, snack foods, etc. 

In the future Juraita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is fifty years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Lucy works very hard to provide for them.

Lucy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lucy has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as milk, spices, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, etc.

In the future Lucy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is forty-one years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Marlyn is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Marlyn has been buying and selling livestock for twenty-one years now, and has borrowed nineteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is thirty-nine years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Norma has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as spices, eggs, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

In the future Norma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is forty-one years old and married with one child.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and paid for nineteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Vilma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is forty-one years old and married with three children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as cheese curls, canned goods, soft-drinks etc.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid for seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for twelve years and also earns an income from rice milling and hog raising.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to build a mini-grocery at a public market.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as cheese curls, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a food production/sales business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for nineteen years.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Yibeden Group

texts.fr:
Mme PHILOMENE est la représentante du groupe YIBEDEN. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 32ans le moins âgé a 19ans. 03 de ses enfants  vont à l’école et elle a 08 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des pagnes baoulé et des bijoux. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne à ABIDJAN en Côte d’Ivoire .Ses clients sont les amis et les voisins.

Mme veut  s’acheter  30 pagnes baoulé et des bijoux.

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique pour son activité.
texts.en:
Philomène is the representative of the Yibeden group. She is married and mother to six children, the eldest being 32 years old and the youngest 19. Three of her children are at school and she has eight dependents.

Philomène sells Baoulé "pagnes" (highly decorative pieces of fabric with a geometric design) and jewelry. She has been carrying out this activity for the past year and gets her supplies in Abidjan in the Ivory Coast. Her customers are friends and neighbors.

She wants to buy 30 Baoulé "pagnes" and jewelry.

She saves her profits and has an ambition to open a large shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy 30 Baoulé "pagnes" and jewelry

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Angelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Berlyn

texts.en:
Berlyn is thirty years old and married with two children.

Berlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Berlyn has borrowed and paid for five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Berlyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elvira

texts.en:
Ma. Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock and ingredients for her food-vending business.

Ma. Elvira has been in this business for twenty-three years. Ma. Elvira earns other income from buying and selling rice.

Ma. Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expaning her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a entertainment (videoke) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari sari (general) store. Myrna is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional unit and pay for the maintenance of her entertainment (videoke) machines.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase an additional unit and pay for the maintenance of her videoke machines.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is married with two children. Jovy is thirty-one years old and lives in Cahayag, Tudela.

Jovy is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. Jovy has been doing this for six years. Jovy has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic ones. 

Jovy has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jovy hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Fotemogoban sont mariées  majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec 43 ans en moyenne et 6 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes le village de Donsobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales (riz et mil), d’arachide et de pain. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, Bintou (assise en 2ème position de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de céréales dans le village de Donsobougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de mil en gros à la foire de Cinzana Gare. La revente s’effectuera au comptant  à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Bintou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments
texts.en:
The eight women in the Fotemogoban group are married, the majority of them living in polygamous families and averaging 43 years of age with six children each. They all live in the village of Donsobougou in the Ségou region (Mali's fourth administrative region) and got to know each other through neighbors, relatives and marriage. They all have small businesses selling cereals (rice and millet), groundnuts and bread. With a view to expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their first group loan.

Bintou (who is sitting second from the left towards the right of the photo) is a large seller of cereals in the village of Donsobougou and the surrounding areas. She is planning to use her loan to buy four sacks of millet from wholesalers at the Cinzana Gare fair. She will resell this for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. With this loan, Bintou is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in the business and cover the restocking of condiments in the household.

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr:
Adidjatou est une femme  âgé(e) de 45 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur.  Elle a 03 enfants. Le premier a 22 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.  
Adidjatou travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 1990. Elle exerce son activité avec 01 personne au marché.
Adidjatou a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut agrandir son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adidjatou voudrait diversifier la marchandise.  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en: Adidjatou is a 45-year old woman who is married to a driver. She has three children, the eldest being 22 years old and the youngest 18. Adidjatou has been working as a retailer of cereals since 1990 and carries out her business with another person in the market. She has requested her second loan from WAGES to buy cereals as she wants to expand her business. In the coming years, Adidjatou would like to diversify the merchandise she sells. She says that with the profits she makes she plans to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Borrower Bayasgalan is a thirty-four-year-old married woman who lives with her family in a district without basic infrastructure near Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Bayasgalan supports her family, by operating a clothing retail stall business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She has been doing this for eight years. She sells clothes which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

Though she is still paying back her previous Kiva loan, she is requesting an additional loan of 1,200,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase more clothing for the spring and in order to increase her working capital after a traditional Mongolian holiday. 

This is her third Kiva loan and she is one of the very trusted and repeat clients of Transcapital CoLtd., who is thankful to all the wonderful Kiva lenders in the world.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell this spring.

loans.name: Elmo

texts.en:
Elmo is married with no children. Elmo is forty-four years old and lives in the Philippines.

Elmo is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years. He has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides.

Elmo has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Elmo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for rice production.

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is married with seven children. Rosana is forty-four years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosana is a farmer and breeds pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase little pigs, feed and vitamins.

Rosana has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rosana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase little pigs, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella is married with five children. Annabella is fifty-eight years old and lives in the Philippines.

Annabella is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for thirty years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

Annabella has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Annabella hopes to have enough savings for her family future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is thirty-eight years old and lives in Mialen,Clarin. Arceli is married with three children. 

Arceli works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. Arceli has been doing this for twenty years. Arceli has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Arceli has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Arceli hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is a local rice farmer from Kompong Speu province. She is married and lives there with her family: her husband and two children. Phat, together with her spouse, heads the family's agricultural business. She grows rice crops on the family-owned plot of land. From this type of business, she is able to earn suitable income to cover her daily expenses. 

Phat requested credit to purchase to purchase construction supplies to start to rebuild and renovate her house. She will buy in particular boards to replace her walls, windows and a ladder to get up to her house. In the future, Phat will upgrade the method she has applied for her farming work. She wishes to buy different kinds of farming materials like a water pump, a plowing machine and a rice husking machine as well.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to start to rebuild and renovate her house.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long, age forty-eight, is a married woman who has farmed in Kompong Cham province since she was young. She has been blessed with three children who are single. Two of them work in various jobs and places. Her elder son is a goldsmith apprentice in Battambang province and her daughter is a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh city. Her last-born child still depends on Long’s primary income. She particularly harvests her rice crops annually and the earnings from this is used to cover the family' household expenses, especially food.

She is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to rent a booth in a local market of Battambang, where her son can provide his goldsmith service. With the remaining balance of the funds, she will buy some of the materials that her son needs for the process of making and repairing gold, silver and others. She hopes that her family will gain a good income from the investment.

loans.use: to rent a booth and buy some necessary materials for her son for his goldsmith and silversmith business.

loans.name: Cruz Encarnación

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Cruz, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  20 y 14 años  de edad, el menor estudia en colegio, sus dos hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además de ciertos artículos de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando están desocupados, su tienda es muy frecuentada por sus clientes ya que allí ellos encuentran de todo además de una excelente atención de su parte.  Tiene más de diez años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y ciertos artículos de papelería ya que se viene la época de entrada a clases y quiere tener mucha mercadería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez mejora mucho más su local.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y aumentarlo  cada día más.
texts.en:
The Chimborazo cooperative bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feasts of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happiness of its people.

This is where we get to know Cruz, who is 43 years old, married, and from this relationship has two children ages 20 and 14.  The youngest is in school, and her two children still live at home.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a general store in her house, where she sells all types of products such as:  rice, sugar, oils, and detergents, in addition to bazaar and paper products.  She works every day from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm, and sometimes even later.  Her children help her with the business when they have free time.  Her customers visit her store frequently since they can find everything they need and also receive excellent service.  She has been in business for more than ten years, and things are going very well for her.

She will use this loan to supply her store, buying rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and certain paper products as the start of the school year is approaching and she wants to have a lot of merchandise.  She has been a member of the cooperative bank since its inception, and she likes it because the loans have helped her improve her store every time.

Her goal is to continue forward with her business, and grow it more and more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and paper products.

loans.name: Saye Sy

texts.fr:
Madame Saye Sy  est restauratrice depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle loge dans un village situé à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Elle est une habituée de la caisse car elle est à son 5ème crédit. Avec ce dernier  qu’elle  demande, elle va acheter  du riz, de l’huile et les autres ingrédients qui vont  dans la cuisine  pour préparer de succulents mets qu’elle revend.
Saye sy appui son époux dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de la maison ; elle réussi à améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Avec les bénéfices acquis, elle aimerait faire quelques travaux de construction chez eux.
texts.en:
Saye Sy has been a restaurant owner for over 20 years. She is married and a mother. She lives in a village located about 22 kms from the main town. She is a regular customer of the branch and is on her 5th loan. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy rice, oil and other ingredients needed to make the delicious meals that she sells.

Saye Sy supports her husband with the management of the daily household expenses and succeeds in improving the family's food conditions. She would like to do some construction work on the home with the profits she earns.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and condiments needed to prepare meals for resale.

loans.name: San Blás Group

texts.es:
San Blas  se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, surgió por contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona y actualmente ya se encuentran en  3° ciclo en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Maria es una de las integrantes de este trabajador grupo, ella se dedica a las ventas. Tiene una despensa hace un tiempo y gracias a las ventas que hace ha podido ir creciendo como comerciante y de esa forma ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy visionaria y trabajadora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, y demás artículos, cuya venta tiene mucha salida.
texts.en:
San Blas is the name of an excellent group of women which formed in the city of Itá. The group emerged after it contacted an advisor at a weekly meeting that was taking place in the area and currently is it in its 3rd loan cycle as a united group with the programme. 

Maria is one of the members of this hard-working group and she works in sales. She has had a store for some time and thanks to the sales that she makes she has been able to grow as a trader and help her family. She is a visionary and hard-working person.

She is requesting this loan to buy groceries, drinks, dairy products and other items, which are in demand.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock their store.

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur habite dans un village qui se situe à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Elle est marié et mère de famille. Ndèye est vendeuse de légumes depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle commence sa journée à 9h et la termine à 15h. Achetant la marchandise chez les maraichers directement, elle vient revendre cela au marché local.
Avec les revenus de son commerce, Ndèye appui son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Et le crédit aura un impact sur les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Elle est à son 4ème crédit et continuera à solliciter des fonds  afin d’augmenter son capital pour voir augmenter aussi son bénéfice.
texts.en:
Ndèye lives in a village located about 22 kms from the main town. She is married and a mother. She has been selling vegetables for over 10 years. She starts her workday at 9 am and finishes at 3 pm. She gets the merchandise directly from the market gardeners and resells it at the local market.

Ndèye uses the income from her business to support her husband with the management of the household expenses. The loan will also affect the family's food conditions. This is Ndèye 's 4th loan and she will continue to request funds so that she can increase her capital and see an increase in her profits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
El señor Amado tiene 65 años de edad, está casado con la señora DelRosario, tienen 3 hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes, viven en una compañía muy conocida de la ciudad de Itá, donde tienen una despensa bien surtida hace mas de 30 años, la cual administra la esposa, allí provee a vecinos y amigos de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar como carne, verduras, leche, carbón, bebidas en general, embutidos y otros, mientras el señor Amado realiza la plantación de caña dulce en hectáreas de tierra que alquila cerca de su domicilio.
El señor Amado solicita el préstamo para la compra de diversos tipos  de insumos para la despensa, como ser verduras, leche, carbón, bebidas a modo de aumentar su stock y pueda generar mayores ventas y por ende más ganancias para seguir ayudando a su familia
texts.en:
Amado is 65 years old and married to DelRosario.  They have 3 children who are already grown and living on their own.  He lives in a renowned area of the city of Itá, where he has had a well-stocked store for more than 30 years that his wife manages.  There, they provide neighbors and friends with all types of articles of first necessity for the home such as meat, vegetables, milk, coal, beverages, canned goods and other products.  Meanwhile, Amado carries out the planting of sugar cane on some hectares of land that he rents near his home.  

Amado requests the loan to buy a variety of items for the store such as vegetables, milk, coal and beverages in order to augment his supply and generate higher sales and, ultimately, to earn more profits to continue to help his family.

loans.use: to buy items to supply his store.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El Sr. Cesar Raúl, es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está casado y vive con su esposa en dicha ciudad. El comenta que se dedica a las ventas, tiene una Despensa en su casa, donde la encargada de atender el negocio es su esposa. Él aparte de ser comerciante también es agricultor, ya que tiene plantaciones de soja y otros tipos de productos.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se esfuerza al máximo para poder ayudar a su familia y de esa forma mejorar su estilo de vida, pues es por esto que él se esfuerza al máximo.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, comestibles y demás artículos de primera necesidad, lo cual es el que más salida tiene día a día.
texts.en:
Cesar Raúl is from the city of Encarnación.  He is married and lives with his wife in said city.  He tells us that he dedicates himself to sales, and has a store in his home that his wife tends to.  Apart from being a merchant, he is also a farmer and plants soy crops and other types of products.

He defines himself as a very hard-working person and a fighter, who gives his all to be able to help his family and improve their standard of living.  This is why he gives his maximum effort.

He requests this loan to buy beverages, dairy products, food, and other basic need products, which are what sell the most day to day.

loans.use: to buy products to supply his business.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Fátima se conformo en el año 2008, con mucho esfuerzo ya se encuentran en el 5 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy sacrificadas.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr. Feliciana quien se dedica a la venta de sábanas, esto gracias a las telas que compra con sus créditos, nos comenta que mediante la ayuda que ha recibido de la fundación ha podido mejorar su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma continuar ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, con lo cual podrá seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo y día a día mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fatima group formed in 2008, with a lot of hard work they are now in the 5th loan cycle as a united group within the programme. They are very hard-working and, above all, very self-sacrificing people.

A very moving story is that of Feliciana, who sells sheets, thanks to the fabrics she is able to buy with her loans. She tells us that through the loans she has received from the foundation she has been able to improve her business, her quality of life and her income. Her goal is to continue growing and to be able to continue supporting her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy fabric, which she will invest in her work and improve her family's quality of life day-by-day.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: General Diaz Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre General Díaz se encuentran en el 2º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Ellas son personas muy emprendedoras y con ganas de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus hijos y familiares. Ellas son conocidas en el barrio por su trabajo en conjunto y por las actividades que hacen.
La Sr. Patricia se dedica a la venta de comidas, sabanas y bebidas y nos comenta que le va muy bien, puesto que gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que hace, ha podido formarse una clientela bien definida, lo que la ayuda a tener un buen ingreso. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, panificados, verduras y demás insumos con lo cual podrá seguir vendiendo las comidas que hace.
texts.en:
The members of the General Díaz women's committee are currently on their second loan cycle and are working together in a supportive manner within the program.  They are very entrepreneurial people who have a desire to do well and thereby help their children and family members.  They are well known in their neighborhood for their joint work and activities.

Patricia's business is selling food, drinks and sheets.  She tells us that her business is doing very well because, thanks to the good quality of her products, she has been able to establish a well-defined customer base which helps her to make a good income.  Her goal is to continue working so that she can continue growing as a businesswoman.

Patricia is requesting a loan to buy meat, seasonings, baked goods, vegetables and other supplies so that she can continue selling the food that she makes.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Niño Jesús se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, el cual se encuentra integrado por 14 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 1° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Gloria es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que se dedica a la costura, con lo cual ha podido ayudar a su familia y de esa forma darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que siempre se esfuerza  al máximo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma cumplir con los trabajos que tiene.
texts.en:
Baby Jesus is the name of the excellent group of women formed in the city of Itá, which is comprised of 14 women working happily and in their 1st cycle as a group within the program.  Gloria is the president of the group, and tells us she dedicates herself to sewing, with which she has been able to help her family and give them a better standard of living.  She defines herself as a hard-working and entrepreneurial person, who always puts forth her maximum effort.

She requests a loan for the purchase of fabrics, threads, and other supplies with which she can continue working and therefore fill the orders she has.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads and other supplies.

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Podemos está actualmente en el 1er ciclo, del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas tienen un trabajo independiente, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto para que de esa forma puedan tener un pequeño ahorro con el cual afrontar cualquier inconveniente que pueda surgir.
Una de las miembros, la Sra. Sonia nos comenta que se dedica a la costura de sabanas y fundas de toda clase, y nos dice que gracias a este trabajo ha podido tener los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Su meta es poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y de esa forma poder crecer como profesional.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, las cuales va a utilizar en su taller para poder seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella como sus compañeras, agradecen la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 'Juntos Podemos' group are currently on their first loan cycle within Fundación Paraguaya's Entrepreneurial Women program.  Each member of the group has her own business but they also carry out activities together so that they have a small amount of savings with which to face any problem that may arise.

One of the members of this group is Sonia.  She tells us that her business is sewing all types of sheets and pillowcases.  She says that thanks to this work she has the resources she needs to help her family.  Her goal is to continue investing in her business so that she can grow as a professional.

Sonia is requesting a loan to buy fabric which she will use in her workshop so that she can continue fulfilling her customers' orders.  Both Sonia and her fellow group members are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité  8 De Diciembre se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades de diversas clases, pero también se ayudan en actividades conjuntas con las cuales quieren ayudar al grupo a seguir creciendo.
Adolfina es una de las miembros y nos comenta que se dedica al macate (Venta ambulante), lo cual hace desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella recorre las calles y comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que pasa calor y frio, pero que pese a ello no se deja vencer, pues ella lucha por darle lo mejor a su familia.
Ella acude a la fundación y a kiva, pues desea un crédito, con lo cual comprará frazadas, sabanas y demás artículos, lo cual venderá y de esa forma tendrá un poco mas de ingresos.
texts.en: The "8th of December" group has brought together various neighbors in the city of Santaní.  All members manage their own specific activities, and together want to help the group to continue growing.  Adolfina is a member who sells macate (braided leather) and has done so for some time. She works hard going door to door, working through heat and cold to persevere in helping her family.  She now seeks a loan to buy sheets, blankets and other items to sell in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets and other items

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo  de 25 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de  4 a 10 años. Él tiene un negocio de mercancía que distribuye al detal bajo pedido de sus clientes y estos pagan a crédito y unos pocos de contado. Su negocio lo inició hace 5 años entre familiares y amigos cercanos a quienes les ofreció ropa por encargo; un día al visitar a familiares en las poblaciones cercanas identificó esta misma oportunidad y adicionó como mercado todos estos municipios, apoyado con un capital de trabajo prestado por su madre, para poder responder a todos los pedidos que sus nuevos clientes habían hecho. Hoy tiene una clientela fija y muchas metas de crecimiento, que le permitan lograr ahorros para tener finalmente su propia casa, pero aunque su decisión y capacidad de trabajo son firmes,  su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente, para lograr el cumplimiento de su sueño. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pantalones masculinos, y femeninos e informales, y sabanas, toallas, y electrodomésticos menores, que es la mercancía que hoy han solicitado sus clientes y requiere responderles, ya que su capital de trabajo está en manos de sus clientes que poco a poco pagan por cuotas la mercancía que le han comprado. En su negocio mantiene un margen de utilidad no menor del 43,7%, indicador desde el cual auguramos su potencial de crecimiento y estabilidad microempresarial.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 25 years old and lives to the south west of the city with his spouse and their 3 children, aged 4 - 10 years. He has a merchants business that distributes at items at retail level according to orders from clients, who mainly buy on credit although a few pay in cash.

His business was started 5 years ago amongst family and close friends to whom he offered clothing for delivery. One day, when visiting relatives in nearby towns he noticed the opportunity and added these areas to his market, with the support of capital loaned to him by his mother in order to meet the demands of the new customers he has acquired. 

Today he has a fixed customer base and many aims to grow, that allow him to save money in order to finally have his own home. Although his determination and work capacity are strong, his capital is proving to be insufficient to achieve his dream. For this reason, he is welcoming his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy men's, women's and casual trousers, sheets, towels and small electrical domestic items - which are the products his clients have ordered and which he needs to provide - since his capital is in his client's hands as they pay in installments. His business has a profit margin of no less than 43.7%, a figure which indicates to us his future potential for growth and stability as a small business.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's and casual trousers, sheets, towels and small electircal household appliances.

loans.name: Benicia's Group

texts.es:
El comité Renacer nace mediante el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres todas vecinas en dicho lugar. Este grupo trabaja de forma unida, y es por ello que son reconocidas en su barrio, por su unión y dedicación. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy luchadoras.
La Sra. Marina es una de las miembros de este grupo, y nos comenta que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ya que tiene una despensa y desde muy temprano ya tiene clientes esperándola. Ella nos cuenta que empezó con un negocio pequeño, pero que gracias a su trabajo y dedicación ha podido ir creciendo y llegar a lo que es hoy.
Ella desea abastecer su negocio con mas productos, y es por ello que acude a la fundación y a kiva, ya que desea un crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
The Renacer group was formed by a group of women in a town of the same name. This group is very close-knit and well-known in their community for their unity and dedication. They are very hard-working and ambitious women.
 Marina is a member of the group who starts work very early to run a general store, as her customers seek to buy items first thing in the morning. She started her business as a very small store, and with her work and dedication has now been able to grow it into a larger business. She now wishes to stock the store with more products, and thus seeks a loan from kiva in order to buy varied food items, drinks, produce, etc.

loans.use: to buy items to stock a general store

loans.name: Ñanduti Group

texts.es:
El comité Ñanduti nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este grupo es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  y es destacado en el barrio por el esfuerzo que demuestran las integrantes y por la lucha que día a día hacen para poder salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Marcelina presidenta del grupo, tiene 35 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora  y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación. Ella tiene una mercería bien surtida en donde vende gran variedad de artículos, y es por ello que ya tiene una gran cantidad de clientes fieles a su local.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados, ropas, artículos de bazar y demás artículos para la posterior venta. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que dan a alas personas de salir adelante con sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
The Ñanduti committee came about through the management and support of another committee which was working in their area.  This group is from the city of San Lorenzo and is well known in its neighborhood for the efforts of its members and the hard work they carry out every day so that they can make progress and help their families.

Marcelina is the group's president.  She is 35 years old and is a very entrepreneurial woman who is capable of leading a large group such as this one.  Over the course of their previous loan cycles, she has shown a desire to do well.  Marcelina has a well-stocked store where she sells a large variety of goods.  She already has a large number of customers who are loyal to her business.

Marcelina is requesting a loan to buy footwear, clothing, housewares and other products which she will later sell.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that they give people to make progress in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy items with which to stock her store

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr:
Arame est une dame qui a choisi de vendre du manger pour  subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle vend des beignets. Elle fait cette activité depuis 20 ans et les enfants la connaisse bien et l’adore car en dehors de la facilité à se procurer  ses merveilles, il y a aussi que le gout est très agréable.
Arame sollicite pour la 4ème  fois  un crédit pour acheter de la farine, du sucre et les ingrédients qui vont pour la fabrication des beignets. Avec cette activité, elle peut aider son mari pour les besoins de la dépense quotidienne. Elle réussi aussi à mettre de l’argent de coté. Elle est ambitieuse car elle voudrait diversifier son activité et nourri un projet d’ouvrir  une boutique de prêts à porter.
texts.en:
Arama is a woman who chose to sell food so that she could meet the needs of her family. She has been selling donuts for 20 years and the children know her well and love her as, other than the fact that her culinary wonders are very easy to obtain, they taste very nice.

Arame is requesting a loan for the 4th time so that she can buy flour, sugar and other ingredients needed to make donuts. Her business allows her to help her husband with the daily expenses. She is also able to put some money aside. She is ambitious as she would like to diversify her business and nurtures the ambition of opening a ready-to-wear clothes shop.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients needed to make donuts for resale.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 14  integrantes en la ciudad de Encarnación, el comité ya tiene un poco de experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que llevan meses trabajando juntas, se reúnen cada semana para compartir juntas sus logros y de esa forma también poder enfrentar los problemas que puedan surgir día a día.
Una de las integrantes, Jorgelina,  está acompañada con Fulgencio que trabaja en una yerbatera, tienen 2 hijos. Jorgelina se dedica a la venta de ropa y con los ingresos que ella tiene ayuda a su marido en los gastos de su hogar,  se  integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda salir adelante y progresar con su negocio.
Ells solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder cumplir la demanda de sus clientes. Ella, como el grupo, agradecen a la fundación por la ayuda que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This committee has 14 members and is located in the city of Encarnación.  The committee already has a little experience of team work as they have been working together for months.  They meet every week to share their successes and, in this way, they are also able to face problems that arise day by day.

One of the members of this group, Jorgelina, lives with Fulgencio who works for a company that produces yerba mate.  The couple have two children.  Jorgelina's business is selling clothing and she uses the income that she makes to help her husband with their household expenses.  She joined her neighborhood committee so that, with Fundación Paraguaya's help, she could get ahead and make progress in her business.

Jorgelina is requesting this loan to buy clothing which she will use to stock her business.  In this way, she will be able to meet her customers' demand.  Both Jorgelina and the other members of her group are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the help that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Nahla is a 43-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of six children.

Nahla sells clothes, and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

Nahla is working from her home and she is looking to expand her business so that she can move her business out of her home and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase  clothes for busines purposes

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Feryal is a 48-year-old married woman from Idon, Irbid, Jordan and a mother of four children. She has a grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase goods for her store.

Feryal is looking to expand her store and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her brother-in-law.

Tgahreed is a 29-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Taghreed makes dairy products from milk and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase equipment needed. Because she is under 30 years old, Taghreed's loan is considered as a youth loan.

Taghreed is looking to purchase more goats for her business so that she can increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Hayat is a 42-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Hayat is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase new furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her home

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata  est une vendeuse de légumes au marché local. Elle a démarré cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle sollicite son 4ème  prêt pour  acheter des légumes : carottes, choux, pomme de terre, aubergine douce et aubergine amer, piment... En fait elle n’en manque pas, mais compte tenu de la période, sa clientèle en demande toujours davantage. Et pour ne pas rompre ce lien, elle décide d’être prudente et de disposer d’un fond  suffisant pour  ne pas être en rupture, car les clients pourraient aller voir ailleurs.
 Avec les fruits de son activité, elle se  prend en charge elle même en même temps que sa mère. 
Son seul souci est d’avoir une bonne assise dans son commerce et pour cela elle a besoin des préteurs.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatoumata   is a vegetable seller at the local market. She started this activity over ten years ago. She requests a fourth loan to buy vegetables: carrots, cabbage, potatoes, sweet egg plant, ,sour egg plant, chilli pepper.... In fact she is not short of vegetables but in view of the time of year, her customers demand increasing quantities. So in order to be prepared, she has decided to be cautious and to stock enough to avoid running out, because in that case her customers would buy elsewhere.
With the earnings from her business she takes care of herself and of her mother.
Her only preoccupation is to be well considered in her business and that is why she needs the loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale (cabbage,egg plant,carrots,and various others)

loans.name: Shoma

texts.en:
Shoma is a 36-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Shoma is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 300 JD to do maintenance for her home.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon, 64 years old and married, has been managing her hog-raising business for almost ten years. Describing herself as a patient and industrious woman, she is also involved in making and selling Khmer cakes in the community, earning approximately USD 2.00 per day.

Phon is now requesting a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to buy cashew nuts in bulk from local villagers to stock for future sale. Based upon experience in previous years, she believes that this project will result in significant revenue which she will use to develop her hog-raising business and save for any future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk from local villagers to stock for future sale.

loans.name: Boblawend 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALAMATA est la représentante du groupe BOBLAWEND 2. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans le moins âgé a 12ans. Personne ne  va à l’école et elle a 05 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend du beure de karité ; des  céréales et du tamarin. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 05ans. Sur la photo elle tient un plat rempli de beure de karité. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants comme  (kassoun, toe, léo et nassire). Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  07 sacs de tamarins ; 50 plats de beurre de karité et  06 sacs de maïs.

Elle  utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne  épauler son fils qui évolue dans la menuiserie à agrandir son atelier et ouvrir elle même  son magasin pour stocker ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Mme SALAMATA is the representative of the group called BOBLAWEND 2. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 20 and the youngest 12 years old. None of them attend school and she is responsible for five people. 

Mme Salamata sells shea butter, cereals, and tamarinds. She has been in this business for five years. In the photo, she is holding a bowl filled with shea butter. She buys her wares in the surrounding villages such as  Kassoun, Toe, Léo et Nassire. She sells to both women and men.  

She wants to buy 7 sacks of tamarinds, 50 bowls of shea butter, and six sacks of maize. She uses her profit to grow her business. Her ambition is to help her son, who is developing a carpentry business, to expand his business and to open up her own store for her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy 7 sacks of tamarinds, 50 bowls of shea butter, and six sacks of maize

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa s’active dans l’agriculture depuis plus de 20 ans. Il loge à environ 22 km de la ville principale ou il possède aussi un champ pour faire du maraichage. Il n’a jamais eu de crédit  à l’IMCEC mais pour  augmenter  sa capacité de production, il fait recours  à cette dernière.
Avec le crédit, il va acheter des semences de choux et d’oignons.
Moussa est marié et père de famille et tout ce qu’il fait c’est pour pouvoir nourrir sa famille et subvenir à leur besoins. Il a de grandes ambitions car il aimerait exploiter d’autres terres dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Moussa has been in agriculture for over 20 years. He lives about 22 kilometres from the main town where he also owns a field for market gardening. He has never had an IMCEC loan but to improve his production capacity, he requests one now.
With the loan he will purchase cabbage and onion seeds.
Moussa is married and a father and everything he does is destined to feeding and taking care of his family. He has great ambitions for he would like to farm more land in the future.

loans.use: to buy cabbage and onion seeds for market gardening.

loans.name: Nadyah

texts.en:
Nadyah is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Nadyah is selling clothes and accessories and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase clothes and accessories for business purposes.

Nadyah is looking to expand her business and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more equipment such as tires, glue, spark-plugs and a tire press machine.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 51 years old, married, and has four children. 

He runs a taxi (car transport) business to earn a living, He has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 KES to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Adjo- Vi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADJO-VI est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe nommée Sophie est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Sophie est âgée de 31 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Sophie est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Claude. Le couple a un enfant à leur charge et qui n'est pas scolarisé. Sophie vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari et assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour  faire face à ses différentes charges, Sophie vend des sacs de façon ambulante depuis près de trois ans. Sophie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Sophie désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Sophie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ADJO-VI, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The ADJO-VI group is made up of three people who live in the same neighbourhood. The representant of this group named Sophie is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Sophie is 31 years old and stopped attending school at secondary level. Sophie is married to a mechanic called Claude. The couple have one child who does not go to school. Sophie lives with her child and her husband and they share the family expenses. To cope with her different costs, Sophie has been selling bags on an itinerant basis for about three years. Sophie buys her stock at a market in Benin. In order to enhance her business and to better satisfy the requirements of her customers, Sophie wishes to increase her stock. To do this, Sophie requests together with the other members of ADJO-VI group, a fourth loan from ALIDé.The other loans were repaid correctly.

loans.use: purchase bags.

loans.name: Vidole Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VIDOLE est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Chantale, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Chantale est âgée de 36 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Chantale est mariée à un certain Lucien. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En dehors des quatre enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Chantale vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble les charges de la maison.
