loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Pilagia

texts.en:
Pilagia is 54 years old and widowed with seven children. With 3 children in school, Pilagia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Pilagia has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, cigarettes and other groceries. In the future, Pilagia would like to save enough to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a variety store business in the Philippines.

Lourdes is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as bread, soft-drinks, beverages and other groceries. Lourdes has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Lourdes would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items such as bread, soft-drinks, beverages and other groceries.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana  de 32 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 9 y 11 años, al sur de la ciudad en un barrio que combina escenarios deportivos profesionales, comercio formal e informal, conjuntos residenciales y viviendas. Ella inició su negocio  de vender  productos fritos, como arepas, empanadas, chorizos, papas rellenas, chuzo y chinchurria,  desde el año 2011; su principal clientela la conforman vecinos y visitantes del sector, que le compran de contado todos los días, pues trabaja de lunes a jueves desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche  y de viernes a domingo, desde las 4 hasta las 12 de la noche.  En este sector aunque la competencia es alta,  todos se conocen y compiten, mientras ella se sostiene con precios justos, amabilidad y calidad en sus productos. Su mayor desafío es lograr el crecimiento de su negocio, porque para sus proyecciones le hace falta capital de trabajo y  un mayor equipo humano para lograr sus sueños. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas, como aceite, masa, sal, carne, queso en mayor volumen, para atender su cada vez mas creciente demanda. Mientras Diana trabaja para cumplir sus sueños, maneja una liquidez de 1,35%, una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 44%, indicadores financieros desde los cuales auguramos su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Diana, 32, lives with her husband and two children who are 9 and 11 years old in the south of the city in a neighborhood that combines professional sports venues, formal and informal commerce, residential developments and homes.  She started her business selling fried snacks like arepas [stuffed, grilled corn cakes], turnovers, sausages, stuffed potatoes, brochettes and fried tripe since 2011.  Her main clientele is formed by neighbors and visitors to the sector who buy and pay cash daily because she works Monday through Thursday from 4 in the afternoon until 10 at night and Fridays through Sundays from 4 until midnight.  Competition is high in this sector.  Everyone knows each other and competes but she stays in business with fair prices, kindness and the quality of her products.  Her greatest challenge is attaining business growth because she lacks working capital for her projections and more staff to reach her dreams.

She is applying for a Kiva loan at present, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy raw materials like oil, dough, salt, meat and cheese at higher volume to meet ever expanding demand.  While Diana works to reach her dreams she has 1.35% liquidity and a profit margin on sales of no less than 44%, financial indicators from which we predict growth for her.

loans.use: to buy oil, dough, salt, meat and cheese in greater volume.

loans.name: Jair Enrique

texts.es: Jair  de 26 años de edad, vive al sur de la ciudad y tiene un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios de internet, fotocopiado y llamadas. Su negocio inició hace un año después de haber trabajado administrando un café internet, en un sector del norte de la ciudad, donde adquirió toda su experiencia. Así fue como se ideó con su novia,  empezar este mismo negocio y ella arrendó un local y el puso los equipos e iniciaron su aventura de trabajo. En su negocio cada día crece su clientela y en diferentes épocas no es capaz de responder a esta demanda y esto se ha convertido en el gran desafío para su crecimiento,  porque no tienen el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará,  tres equipos de cómputos y una fotocopiadora mas, con los cuales se preparan para atender la gran demanda de estudiantes, que se aglomera para hacer tareas y trabajar en internet. Su meta mas adelante, es lograr un ambiente cada vez mas confortable y generar empleos , pero eso si en un local propio el cual es el sueño de esta pareja.
texts.en:
Jair, 26, lives in the south of the city and has a business through which he provides Internet access services, photocopying and phone calls.  His business started a year ago after having finished running an Internet café in a sector in the north of the city where he acquired all his experience.  This is how he got the idea with his girlfriend to start this same kind of business.  She rented a locale and he installed the equipment and they started their adventure in work.  His business’ clientele is growing every day and there are times when he’s unable to meet demand which has become his great challenge for growth because they don’t have enough working capital to do so.

This is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy three sets of computer equipment and another photocopier which will prepare them to take care of the great demand they have from students that crowd in to do homework and to work in the Internet.  His goal for later on is to attain an environment that’s more comfortable each time and to generate employment but this time in a locale of their own which is this couple’s dream.

loans.use: to buy three computers and another photocopier.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Raquel has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010, and she hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Alcibiades

texts.es: Alcibíades  de 57 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposa y tres hijos en las edades de 2 a 17 años. Allí tiene un negocio de reciclaje y otro de venta de repuestos de electrodomésticos . Desde hace 30 años aprendió el oficio de reparación de abanicos y licuadoras  y desde el año 1994 consiguió la oportunidad de negociar con chatarras. Gracias a estos dos negocios, ha logrado el sostenimiento de su hogar y adquirió  también vivienda propia. Su meta mas adelante es organizar muy bien sus dos negocios e independizarlos totalmente de su hogar, pero su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente,  para lograr este propósito de manera inmediata. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, para empezar a incrementar su capital de trabajo y poco a poco lograrlo. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales reciclables, como hierro, cobre, bronce y aluminio, pues tiene un deposito como su principal cliente que esta dispuesto a comprar estos productos, así este dinero rotará rápidamente y  allí radicará el efecto positivo que tendría esta inversión. Así mismo comprará repuestos de abanicos, licuadoras  y ollas, que son los artículos que mas vende en su negocio y siempre requiere tener inventarios, para responder rápidamente a su clientela.
texts.en:
Alcibíades, 57, lives in the municipality of Malambo, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla, with his wife and three children whose ages range from 2 to 17 years old. There he owns a recycling business and another business where he sells spare parts for appliances. 
He has repaired fans and blenders for 30 years, and in 1994 he started a business of selling and buying scrap. Thanks to these two businesses, he has managed to support his family and get his own house. 
His long-term goal is to get his two businesses well organized and separate them completely from his house, but his working capital is not enough to immediately reach this goal. This is why he asks for a Kiva loan in order to increase his working capital and reach his goal with time. 
This Kiva loan is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy materials for recycling, such as iron, copper, bronze and aluminum, as he has a deposit from his main customer who is willing to buy these products, so this money will flow quickly, that is why this investment would have a positive effect. 
He will also buy spare parts for fans, blenders and saucepans, as these are the items which he sells the most and he always has to have inventories to meet the needs of his customers in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for recycling, such as iron, copper, bronze and aluminum and spare parts for fans, blenders and saucepans.

loans.name: Edwin Mauricio

texts.es: Edwin  de 28 años, es un joven casado que  tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 6 años.  Él es un trabajador que logra sostener su familia,  a partir de un negocio mediante el cual elabora calzado,  para damas, caballeros y niños, desde el año 2010 cuando inició en el patio de su casa con herramientas muy rudimentarias; poco a poco compró equipamiento y trasladó su negocio a una habitación que acondicionó como su taller, hoy no solo ocupa este cuarto, sino casi toda su casa, pues su negocio ha crecido y cada vez mas, los pedidos aumentan y con ello la tenido que adicionar primero un ayudante,  posteriormente agregó dos mas y hoy cuenta con 3 zapateros, un cortador, un guarnecedor y él mismo, quien trabaja en todo el proceso productivo  especialmente el de diseño, mientras su esposa está a cargo de la comercialización. Con el crecimiento de su negocio,  su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, para lograr responder a su demanda en el mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, suelas, forros, sintéticos, una dobladora, una cortadora de tiras, una vitrina y hormas. Su sueño es abrir un local comercial y crecer como empresa exportadora de calzado, este último es su gran desafío  .
texts.en:
Edwin, 28, is a young married man who has three children whose ages range from 1 to 6 years.  He is a worker who manages to support his family through a business making shoes for women, men and children.  He started the business in 2010 in his patio with very rudimentary tools.  Little by little he bought a more equipment and moved his business into a room that he set up as his workshop.  Today, he not only occupies this room but almost all of the house because his business has grown and each time his orders increase to such a degree that he had to employ a helper and later on two more so that he now has three cobblers, a cutter, a decorator and himself who works in the entire productive process especially in design; his wife takes care of the sales.

With the growth of his business his working capital becomes insufficient to meet market demand which is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy larger amounts of soles, lining, synthetics, a folder, a strip cutter, a display case and shoe trees.  His dream is to open a store and to become a shoe exporting firm; this last is his great challenge.

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 51 years old and a widowed mother of three children. With one child in school, Concepcion works very hard to provide for her family.

Concepcion runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of goods to sell in her store. Concepcion has been in this business for 22 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned good, soft-drinks and beverages. 

In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough to ensure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Charwyl

texts.en:
Charwyl is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Charwyl has a shop where he makes and sells homemade sausage like chorizo & longganisa. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Charwyl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shell craft business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her shell craft business.

Cornelia has been in this business for 30 years. Cornelia earns more income from a variety store.

Cornelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell craft business.

loans.name: Faride Esther

texts.es: Faride  está muy contenta con su anterior credikiva,  pues con él logró comprar una vitrina, cosméticos, accesorios y detalles para el hogar, que vendió rápidamente. Su negocio ha mejorado sustancialmente desde que recibió su credikiva y hoy está aplicando a un segundo financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará bolsos, tratamientos capilares, ropa, calzado, pues tiene varios pedidos con los que responderá a sus clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Les agradezco que me hayan permitido salir adelante en mi `proyecto de vida gracias a ustedes y a Dios especialmente he logrado fortalecer mi negocio. “
texts.en: Faride is very pleased with her previous Kiva loan. She was able to use it to buy a display cabinet, cosmetics, accessories and home goods, which she sold on quickly. Her business has improved substantially since she received her Kiva loan and she is now applying for a second one. She will use it to buy handbags, hair products, clothes and footwear – she has a lot of client orders to fulfil. This is her message to Kiva’s lenders: “Thank you for having allowed me to progress with my project, which is so important to me. Thanks to you and to God in particular, I have succeeded in building up my business”.

loans.use: buy handbags, hair products, clothes and footwear

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque está interesado en comprarse más herramientas de trabajo, que le faciliten y agilicen más su trabajo, comprara una máquina de coser industrial, esto le ayudara para mejorar la sastrería y el trabajo que le realiza a los clientes.
El considera que a través del préstamo anterior pudo mejorar la operacionalidad de la sastrería y generar otros ingresos.
texts.en: Luis decided on a new loan because he’s interested in buying more work tools that will make his work easier and faster.   He will buy an industrial sewing machine that will help him improve his tailor shop and the work he does for customers.  He believes that his previous loan helped him improve the tailor shop’s efficiency and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 28 years old, married, and has four children, of which three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ethel has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more pants, blouses, t-shirts and other clothing.

Ethel has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more trousers, blouses, t-shirts and other clothing.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has runs a business of selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Arlyn is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more drinking water to sell. In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Emilio nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 44 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él  es profesor y ya son 14 años que se dedica a enseñar educación primaria, él es también músico y toca instrumentos de viento como por ejemplo quenas y zampoñas, él también se dedica a escribir libros acerca de la cosmovisión andina.  Emilio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para impresión de la nueva edición de los libros.

Emilio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Emilio belongs to the community bank called Virgencita de Fátima de Lamay which is part of Asociación Araiwa in the province of Calca and department of Cusco, Peru.
Emilio was born in the city of Lamay and is 44 years old. He lives in the city where he was born and where her works. He is a teacher and has been teaching in the primary school for 14 years. He is also a musician and plays wind instruments such as a type of flute and pan pipes. He also writes books about the Andean worldview. Emilio needs a loan now to print a new edition of his books. 
Emilio is grateful for and values the loan and promises to make the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to print the new edition of the books.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
Wilber pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Wilber nació en la ciudad de Calca y tiene 48 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad de Lamay y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él  tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y también se dedica a la agricultura. Wilber en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería para abastecer la tienda y va comprar por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Wilber agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Wilber belongs to the community bank called Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay which is part of Asociación Araiwa in the province of Calca and department of Cusco, Peru.
Wilber was born in the city of Calca and is 48 years old. He lives in the city of Lamay and also works there. He has a small grocery store and is also a farmer. At this time, Wilber needs a loan to buy merchandise to stock his store and is going to buy, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, and other basic groceries. 
Wilder is grateful for and values the loan and agrees to make his monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, and other basic groceries.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yambio. She sells bread and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school.

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase bread to resell. She will use the extra income from her business as a result of this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread to resell.

loans.name: Eudecia

texts.en:
Eudecia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.

Eudecia has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Eudecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Rene nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 32 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él se dedica a la elaboración de cerámica y pintado de la cerámica, él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde pinta y elabora artesanía. Rene en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo para elaborar artesanía y va comprar por ejemplo pintura, madera, esmaltes y otras cosas más.  

Rene agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rene belongs to the community bank called Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay which is part of Asociación Araiwa in the province of Calca and department of Cusco, Peru.
Rene was born in the city of Lamay and is 32 years old. He lives in the city where he was born and where he works. He works making ceramics and painting what he makes. He has a small workshop in his home where he paints and makes crafts. At this moment, Rene needs a loan to by work materials to make crafts and is going to buy, for example, paint, wood, enamels, and other things. 
Rene is grateful for and values the loan and agrees to make his monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to make drafts and to buy, for example, paint, wood, enamels, and other things.

loans.name: Brenda Esperanza

texts.es:
La joven Brenda residente en una colonia al sur San Lorenzo, ella vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, además ella y su familia viven en casa de sus padres.
Ella se dedica desde hace ya unos 11 años al negocio de venta y elaboración de pan, rosquillas, venta de lácteos, paletas y jugos naturales, su venta es ambulante en los caseríos y barrios aledaños a su comunidad, muy temprano visita escuelas, y viviendas para vender sus producto, y solicita el préstamo para compra de leña, azúcar, huevos, pan, lácteos, etc. 
Brenda con las utilidades que genere en su negocio desea mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y comprarles lo necesario para que ha ellos no les falte nada, y también desea incrementar el negocio para así tener mejores ganancias.
El sueño de Brenda es tener su propia casa y que su negocio crezca y sea  estable para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Brenda is a young woman who lives in a southern district of San Lorenzo. She is married with two children and the family lives in Brenda’s parents’ house.

For 11 years now her work has consisted in making and selling bread, doughnuts, dairy products, ice-lollies and fresh juices. She travels around the local area selling her products in nearby villages and neighbourhoods. She goes out very early to sell her products to schools and households. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy firewood, sugar, eggs, bread, dairy products etc.

Brenda aims to use the income generated by her business to send her children to school and buy them what they need so that they never want for anything. She would also like to grow her business so that she can increase her profits. 

Brenda’s dream is to have her own house and to grow her business so that it is stable and she is able to provide her children with a better quality of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy firewood, eggs, flour, sugar, milk and other products for her business

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en: This time, for her 13th loan cycle, Ethel is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund her food production business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Ethel and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Thelma would like to build and expand her business to increase the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ma. Lydia

texts.en:
Ma. Lydia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell crafts business in the Philippines.

Ma. Lydia requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafts business. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Ma. Lydia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafts business.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en: Kawthar is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children in Gaza. On the 1st of May 2011, Kawthar opened her mini market. She hopes to use this loan to improve her market by purchasing shelves, display boxes, and a refrigerator in order to be able to sell a wider variety of goods.

loans.use: to purchase shelves, display boxes, and a refrigerator for her mini market.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel works hard to support her family. Rachel is married and has a personal products sales business in the Philippines.

Rachel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more body lotions, deodorants, perfume, and other personal products.

Rachel has been in this business for five years now and also earns additional income from a variety store.

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more body lotion, deodorant, perfume, and other personal products.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en: Saeed is 21-year-old single man from Gaza. He has a clothing store; he started his project on the 1st of June 2011. He hopes to get this loan in order to buy shelves, an AC, and new clothes for his store, thus he would able to improve his business, leading to increased profit and income.

loans.use: to buy shelves, an AC, and new clothes for his store

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are still in school.

Angelina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase charcoal for resale. She will use the extra income from her business as a result of this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos  de 52 años de edad vive muy cerca al escenario deportivo más importante de la ciudad de Barranquilla, la Costa caribe y Colombia, donde juegan equipos profesionales de futbol. En este barrio compuesto por múltiples alternativas productivas, formales e informales, él tiene también su pequeño almacén donde vende ropa de bebe, que confecciona en su propio taller, desde que llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 10 años para radicarse, procedente de su natal departamento de Santander y emprender en el año 2000 su propio negocio, como es usual en la cultura de los oriundos de este departamento; Carlos muy pronto conquistó una clientela conformada por vecinos que hoy le compran al por mayor y almacenes de la Costa Atlántica;  con ellos  gradualmente ha ido incrementando su clientela y aunque maneja una alta competencia, pero se sostiene con precios justos y calidad en sus productos y el servicio. Sus clientes le pagan a 30 o a 60 días, esta es la razón por la cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, segundo financiamiento que hace a esta organización y primer credikiva, con el cual planea  financiar su cartera, comprando con este capital materias primas y accesorios para elaborar ropa de bebe y otros artículos como cunas, toldos, pañaleras, caminadores etc. Su inversión tendrá èxito porque conoce muy bien su mercado y tendrá un capital de trabajo adicional para hacer compras en más volumen que el acostumbrado, lo que se convierte en una ventaja competitiva para negociar precios. Con su crédito anterior logró adquirir mayor liquidèz, vitrina y en consecuencia ha mejorado su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, 52, lives very near the most important sports venue in the city of Barranquilla, the Caribbean coast and Colombia where professional soccer games are played.  This neighborhood has many formal and informal productive  alternatives.  He has a small store where he sells clothing for infants that he has been making in his own shop since he moved to Barranquilla ten years ago to live here.  He came from his native Santander Department in 2000 to start his own business as is usual for natives of this department.  

Very quickly Carlos won over a clientele made up of neighbors who now buy from him at wholesale and stores on the Atlantic coast.  He’s gradually been increasing his clientele with them even though he has a lot of competition but he stays in business thanks to fair prices and quality products and service.  

His customers pay him in 30 or 60 days and this is why he’s calling on Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, his second loan from this institution and first from Kiva that he plans to use to finance his portfolio buying raw materials and accessories to make clothes for infants and other items like cradles, covers, diaper bags, walkers, etc.

His investment will be successful because he knows his market very well and he’ll have additional working capital to buy in volumes higher than usual which is a competitive edge in negotiating prices.  He managed to attain greater liquidity and a display case with his previous loan consequently improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and accessories to make baby clothes and other items like cradles, covers, diaper bags, walkers, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Romeo

texts.es:
Don Oscar de 45 años de edad, es casado vive con sus cuatro hijos, su esposa esta en España y le apoya económicamente a través de las remesas que ella  le envía, tiene casa propia ubicada en una colonia de san Lorenzo.
 Don Oscar se dedica desde hace 21 años a la actividad de construcción de casas, con esta actividad a podido salir adelante con su familia, y solicita el préstamo para compra de cemento ya que esta construyendo una casa para habitar el y su familia.
A través de este préstamo podrá terminar su casa ya que necesita el material para ponerle el piso y de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida y la su familia.
El sueño de Don Oscar es instalar un negocio en su casa ya que necesita más ingresos para terminar de graduar a sus hijos que están estudiando en la escuela y el colegio.

San Lorenzo, honduras – Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Oscar is 45 years old. He is married and lives with his 4 children. His wife is in Spain and she supports him with the remittences that she sends home. He has his own home located in San Lorenzo.
Oscar has been working in construction for 21 years, building houses. Thanks to this work, he has been able to get ahead with his family. He is requesting the loan to buy cement as he is building a house for himself and his family.
This loan will enable him to finish his house and he needs the material to pour the floor. This will improve his quality of life and that of his family.
Oscar's dream is to open a business in his home as he needs more income so that his children can finish their education (they are in grade  school and high school).
San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy cement to pour the floor for his house.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Doña Martina  de 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un nieto que depende de ella, tiene casa propia, su casa esta ubicada en San Lorenzo.
Doña Martina se dedica desde hace unos 9 años a elaborar y vender tortillas para los vecinos de la comunidad, muy temprano todo los días de lunes a domingo prepara en dos jornada las tortillas para ser vendidas en su casa, hasta su casa llegan los clientes que ella tiene a comprarle sus tortillas, a Doña Martina le ayuda  una de sus hijas a preparar sus tortillas.
Doña Martina esta solicitando 7,000.00 lempiras a PRISMA  para comprar maíz y leña para elaborar sus tortillas. 
Con las ganancias de su negocio ella  le compra medicina a su nieto y le compra la ropa que usa en la escuela.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su negocio y su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Doña Martina is 52 and a single mother.  She has one grandson who depends on her.  She has her own home, which is located in San Lorenzo.  Doña Martina has made and sold tortillas to neighbors in her community for 9 years.  She makes them very early every day from Monday through Sunday to sell in her home.  Her customers go to her home to buy their tortillas.  One of her daughters helps her make the tortillas.  Doña Martina is requesting 7,000 lempiras from Prisma to buy corn and firewood to make her tortillas.  With the earnings from her business, she will buy medicine for her grandson and buy him clothes to wear for school.  Her dream is to keep working to help her business and family get ahead.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. She is widowed and runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years.

Angelina is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and other groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and other groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: German

texts.es: German vive en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 21 años respectivamente; allí se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, oficio que aprendió cuando un zapatero llegó a esta población, puso un taller y German trabajó como su ayudante durante varios años. Así mismo vende productos agrícolas de manera estacionaria, es decir en cada cosecha, esta  actividad la aprendió por tradición de su padre quien la practicaba.  Con estas actividades ha logrado generar el sustento de su hogar y ha sido apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 2 años. Con los financiamientos de esta organización, ha logrado tener en sus manos un capital de trabajo mas, para poder hace negociaciones  efectivas, pues antes trabajaba con créditos costosos de particulares y en manos de ellos quedaba la mayor parte de las ganancias que producía su trabajo. Hoy con sus créditos, ha conseguido mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y sueña con hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, aprovechando que vive en un corredor muy comercial y tienen la potencialidad para desarrollarse y crecer. En la actualidad esta aplicando a su credikiva, tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación, con el cual comprará materiales, para trabajar nuevos diseños de calzado, comprará  también mochilas y bolsos para la venta y aguacates, su inversión será exitosa porque conoce su mercado y el movimiento de estos productos, por eso aumentará sus inventarios y podrá responder a los pedidos  de sus clientes muy rápidamente.
texts.en:
German lives in San Jacinto, a town in Bolívar Department, with his spouse and two children who are 14 and 21 years old respectively.  He works making shoes there, an occupation he learned when a cobbler came to this town and set up a workshop and German worked as his assistant for many years.  He also sells agricultural products seasonally, that is, at each harvest; he learned this activity by tradition since that was his father’s occupation.  With these activities he’s managed to support his home and for the last two years has been getting help from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

With this organization’s loans he’s been able to have more working capital on hand to be able to carry out effective negotiations because he used to work with costly loans from individuals who ended up keeping most of the profits his work produced.  Today with his loans he’s attained better living conditions and he dreams with making his business grow much more taking advantage of the fact that he lives in a very commercial sector with much growth potential.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the third financing he’s gotten from the Fundación that he will use to buy materials to make new shoe designs.  He will also buy backpacks and purses to sell as well as avocadoes.  

His investment will be successful because he knows his market and the movement of those products well.  Because of this he will increase his inventories to respond quickly to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo de 28 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancías como ropa, colonias, accesorios etc. Él vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de dos años,  en el municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno. Marcelo para iniciar su negocio aprovechó la experiencia que tenia su cónyuge en el comercio, pues trabajaba en su propio negocio,  antes de irse a España en busca de trabajo, por eso y cuando regresó,  rescató su mercado para que Marcelo iniciara esta misma actividad, con sus mejores clientes. Su meta más adelante es tener un almacén bien posicionado en el pueblo, con varias líneas de productos comerciales. Su gran desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa informal, como pantalones y cosméticos;  su inversión será exitosa porque tendrá un capital de trabajo mas y disponible,  para hacer sus compras,  sin tener que esperar a que sus clientes, a quienes les ha vendido a crédito le paguen. Mientras trabaja para alcanzar su sueño, maneja una rentabilidad no menor al 40%, indicador financiero desde la cual proyectamos un crecimiento exitoso, debido a su experiencia,  apoyada por su cónyuge y a la potencialidad de su mercado.
texts.en:
Marcelo, 28, sells merchandise like clothes, cologne, accessories, etc.  He lives with is spouse and two year old son in the town of San Juan Nepomuceno.

To start his business, Marcelo took advantage of experience his spouse had in commerce because she worked in her own business before going to Spain in search of employment.  When she returned, she recovered her market so that Marcelo could start the same activity with her best customers.  His goal for later on is to have a well situated store in town with several lines of commercial products.  His great challenge is not having enough working capital to accomplish this.

He is applying for a Kiva loan at present, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy informal clothes, like pants, and cosmetics.  His investment will be successful because he will have more working capital at hand for his purchases without having to wait for his customers that he’s sold to on credit to pay him back.

While working towards reaching his dream, he has a profit margin of no less than 40%, a financial indicator from which we can project successful growth due to his experience supported by his spouse and his market potential.

loans.use: to buy informal clothes, like pants, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Aristides

texts.es:
Don  Rosa  de 59  años de edad, el vive  con su pareja de hogar y sus  dos nietos, su residencia habitacional  es en San Lorenzo Valle, su dedicación es Transporte de Personas.
Don Rosa trabaja  en Su bus propio a personas que  viajan de la ciudad de Choluteca a la ciudad de Comayagua,  así es como Don Rosa puede sostener a su familia. 
El  solicita 20,000.00 lempiras a PRISMA para poder comprar repuestos para su vehículo 
Con las utilidades que el obtiene es para poder darle un mejor mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que de ello depende el desarrollo de su familia.
Don Rosa desea seguir trabajando con PRISMA porque ha  sido su impulsador en su economía ya que  con él ha logrado una buena estabilidad laboral.
El sueño de Don Rosa es seguir trabajando en su vehículo  para sacar adelante  su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Don  Rosa is 59 and lives with his wife and his two grandchildren.  His home is in San Lorenzo Valley.  He has a transportation business.  Don Rosa runs his own bus for people that travel from the city of Choluteca to the city of Comayagua.  This is how he supports his family.  He is requesting 20,000 lempiras from Prisma to be able to buy parts for his vehicle.  He will be able to maintain his vehicle better since his family's development depends on it.  Don Rosa hopes to keep working with Prisma because it has motivated him with his finances since he has obtained good job stability.  His dream is to keep working with his vehicle to take good care of his family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Zoila de 44 años de edad, es casada  tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa de su madre en san Lorenzo, Honduras.
Doña Zoila Tiene un negocio de compra venta de ropa usada, en las afueras del antiguo mercado de san Lorenzo, ahí ella vende pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa para niños, calzonetas, etc.
 Con el préstamo comprara mas ropa usada clasificada ya que la demanda de este tipo de producto es muy buena en esta época del año, sus clientes son sus amigos y vecinos que a diario le visitan, de esta manera obtendrá mejores ganancias y así podrá comprar a sus hijos sus útiles escolares y otro materiales para la escuela y colegio.
El sueño de Doña Zoila es tener otro negocio y un local más grande para exhibir su mercadería.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Doña Zoila is 44, married, and has 2 children that depend on her.  She lives in her mother's home in San Lorenzo, Honduras.  Zoila has a business buying and selling used clothing on the outskirts of an old market in San Lorenzo.  There she sells pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, swimsuits, etc.

With this loan, she will buy more used clothing since the demand for this kind of product is very good this time of year.  Her customers are her friends and neighbors that visit her daily.  In this way, she will obtain better profits and be able to buy her children their school supplies and other materials that they need for elementary and secondary school.

Zoila's dream is to have another business and a larger location to display her merchandise.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012

loans.use: to buy used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She sells scrap metals to earn a living and she has been in the business for 11 years. She describes her customers as low income earners because most of them live in slums. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy scrap metals for resale.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals for resale.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael tiene 52 años de edad, él es casado y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 16 y 32 años. Él se dedica a la venta de mercancía que promociona mediante guías especializadas de productos; su actividad inició desde hace 11 años, cuando trabajando como vigilante, decidió alternar su trabajo con una actividad que simultáneamente generara ingresos suficientes, para el sostenimiento de su familia. Fue así como en compañía de su esposa durante 5 años fabricaban  chicha,  logando una venta diaria de 300 bolsas, las cuales repartían entre tiendas y a particulares ubicados en su sector, pero por complejidad del transporte diario del producto, que debían trasladarlo desde la ciudad de Barranquilla hasta la Urbanización la Playa, decidieron no seguir y dedicarse a tener una vivienda propia. Fue así como se instalaron en un terreno donde poco a poco construyeron la vivienda que hoy poseen, inicialmente fue de madera, pero poco a poco lograron construirla en cemento y dejaron un espacio locativo decidido con el propósito de tener una tienda. Allí vendían artículos de la canasta familiar por un tiempo de 3 años, pero la proliferación de este tipo de negocios en el sector, los obligó a cambiar de actividad por una heladería y donde también estuvieron 3 años más, pues el hurto continuo del cableado eléctrico,  casi los dejó descapitalizados, teniendo que arrendar el local, con el fin de generar ingresos mas seguros. Rafael y su esposa decidieron entonces, vender mercancías en general y vincularse con proveedores que le suministran catálogos para promocionar los productos. Rafael también tiene 14 años de trabajar como vigilante de un edificio y maneja su propia clientela. Siempre apoyado por su esposa, ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, sexto crédito que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que está vinculado, hace 8 años y de su mano ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales. Con su credikiva planea continuar mejorando su vivienda y levantar paredes, pues tiene problemas de humedad que afectan a su vecino, así mismo terminará de construir una de sus habitaciones en la parte trasera de la vivienda,  para lograr el acomodamiento de toda su familia en su hogar y mayor sosiego.
texts.en:
52 year old Rafael is married and has 2 children who are 16 and 32 years old. He works selling goods that he promotes through special catalogs. He began doing this 11 years ago when he was working as a guard. He decided to combine his job with other work that would also generate income in order to support his family. In this way, along with his wife, he spent 5 years making chichi (a sort of fermented drink), and reached daily sales of 300 bags which they delivered to stores and people in the neighborhood. But, because of transport complications for their product, which they had to move from the city of Barranquilla to the La Playa urban area, they didn't continue and decided to focus on having their own home.  So, they got some land where, little by little, they built the house that the own today. At first they built it of wood, but, little by little, they were able to build parts from cement and they left a space empty with the idea of having a store there.  They sold family groceries there for 3 years but the proliferation of these sorts of businesses in the neighborhood obliged them to change their store to an ice cream place, which they then ran for 3 more years. However, the continuous theft of electrical wiring almost left them broke and they had to lease the store space so that they could have a more secure income. Then Rafael and his wife decided to sell general supplies and to link themselves to companies that use catalogs to promote their products. 
Rafael also has 14 years of work experience as a guard and has his own clients. Always supported by his wife, he has been able to bring up his children. At this time, he is applying for a Kiva loan and this will be the 6th loan he has received through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization he has been associated with for 8 years and which has helped him to grow his business and improve his living conditions. With his Kiva loan, he plans to continue improving his home and building walls. He has damp problems that are affecting his neighbor and also will finish building one of the rooms in the back part of the house so that there is space for all the family and greater peace.

loans.use: to build walls as he has a problem with damp, and to build a room in the back part of his house.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 43-year-old lady from Kilgoris.  She is single and has four children between the ages of 12 and 20 years.

Paulina operates a clothes selling business, which she has been doing for the last 10 years. From the business, she makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is now taking her third loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of clothing for resale. Her profits will be used to add more clothing stock. Her dream is to grow her business so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.

Vivian has pigpen and she sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Vivian has been a member of HSPFI since 2001.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Рачабгул жительница города Вахдат. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее 8 детей. Рачабгул занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее смешанный ассортимент товара. Торговлей Рачабгул занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Rajabgul is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  She is 44 years old, married and has eight children.  Rajabgul is involved in sales at a market.  She has a mixed selection of merchandise.  Rajabgul has been in sales for seven years.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruits.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Habil

texts.ru: Habil 43 qoda. On zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Odin iz yego diyet uchitsya uje v universitete. Habil yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda. On seychas jivet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Habil nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye svoyego magazina dlya togo chtobi umestit tam bolshe tovarov. Seychas on prodayot tolko pisheviye produkti no uvelichiv pomesheniye on nachnet prodovat i moyushiye sredstva. Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
Habil is 43 years old.  He is married and has three children.  One of his children studies at a university.  Habil is an IDP from the city of Fuzuli.  He currently lives in the Fuzuli region together with his wife and children.  Habil needs 1600 AZN to expand his store space in order to include more merchandise there.  Currently, he sells only food products, but after expanding the space, he will begin to also sell cleaning supplies.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person who have been forced or obliged to flee his home, in particular as a result of an armed conflict, violence, violations of human rights or natural or human-made disasters, and who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an internationally recognised State border and remains on the territory of his own country. (source: UN Guiding Principles on Coordination of Humanitarian Questions)

loans.use: to expand his store space

loans.name: Adán

texts.es:
El señor Adán y su esposa son un matrimonio joven y tiene dos hijos de pequeña edad que están estudiando la primaria. Don Adán es empleado de una cocina en un comedor industrial, y esposa se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos. 
Están solicitando el préstamo ya que le esta haciendo falta la barda trasera de su casa, necesitan comprar el material que es block. Cemento. Varilla, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejorar. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio, la calidad de vida y seguridad de su familia mientras estén en su casa.
texts.en: Señor Adán and his wife have a young marriage.  He has two young children who are studying in elementary school.  Don Adán works in a company's kitchen.  His wife is in charge of taking care of their kids.  They are requesting a loan because they need to build a wall behind their home.  They need to buy materials for it, like cement, rods, and sand, and they need to pay the person who will do the labor.  He hopes to improve his family's income, quality of life, and safety while they are in his home.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Diosdado has a bakeshop that sells breads and pastries. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 18,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making breads and pastries.

Diosdado has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads and pastries

loans.name: Gulgaky

texts.ru: Гулгакы 62 года, вдова, воспитала 4 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Гулгакы занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 1992 году с 6,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 2 коровы, 1 теленок, 5 овец и 8 коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулгакы обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Гулгакы планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Gulgaky is 62 years old, a widow and raised four children.  She is involved in animal husbandry to provide a source of income for her family.  The business, started in 1992 with 6,000 som (KGS), today yields about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  Today, her business contains two cows, one calf, five sheep and eight goats.  In order to further develop her business, Gulgaky requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña María vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, sus hijos estudian en una escuela de su comunidad, ella tiene su casa en un barrio de San Lorenzo, Honduras, Doña María tiene su negocio en su vivienda.
El negocio de Doña María es la venta de frescos, enchiladas, tacos, baliadas, y algunos productos de consumo diario.
Doña María Esta solicitando 8,000.00 lempiras dinero que desea invertir en la compra de verduras, frescos de botella, carnes, lactaos y jugos.
Con las utilidades desea seguir abasteciendo su negocio para hacerlo cada día más fuerte, ya que desea seguir teniendo el financiamiento de PRISMA para que su negocio vaya creciendo.
El sueño de María es que su negocio crezca y sea el mejor de la zona en donde ella vive  para darle una mejor vida a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Doña María lives with her husband and two children.  Her children study in an elementary school in the community.  Their home is in a neighborhood in San Lorenzo, Honduras.  Doña María has her business in her home, where she sells drinks, enchiladas, tacos, baliadas [tortillas folded in half and filled with refried beans], and some products for daily use.  Doña María is requesting 8,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of vegetables, bottled drinks, meat, dairy products, and juice.  She wants to keep stocking her business to make it stronger every day.  She hopes to keep having financing from Prisma so her business will keep growing.  María's dream is to grow her business and have it be the best in the area where she lives so she can give her family a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March, 2012

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, meat, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is a 39-year-old lady who is married and has four children, Sardi, 21 and Alfa, 19, who graduated from Senior High School; Dominggus, who is attending 2nd grade of Junior High School, and Nikson who is 3 years old.

Yuliana runs a weaving shawl business. She usually produces 50 shawls in a month since she has regular customer who often come to buy the shawls directly to be resold at the art shop. In addition, Yuliana sometimes spends her spare time planting vegetables at their farm with her husband.
 
In order to meet her customer demands, Yuliana requested a loan from TLM for IDR 4,000,000 to purchase knitting yarn for her shawl business and seedlings for their farm.

loans.use: to purchase knitting yarn for her shawl business and seedlings for their farm.

loans.name: Nanus

texts.en: Nanus, a 30-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school, lives in Yei where she has been operating a food stall for five years. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and is requesting her first loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase tomatoes and beans to sell. Nanus will use the extra income arising from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and beans for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret, a 50-year-old mother of six children between 10 and 25 years of age, lives in Migori and is married to Joshua. She has been selling cereals, mainly maize cereal, for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES.10,000.

Margret is now requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to buy a stock of maize cereal, the profits from which she will use to repay the loan. Her dream is to increase her stock of maize.

loans.use: to buy a stock of maize cereal.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, age 33, is a farmer in Takeo Province in Cambodia. She and her husband have two children. She has been involved in growing and harvesting crops for over 20 years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a carpenter who manufactures tables, beds, chairs, and other furniture items. He earns about USD 4 per day.

In order to improve her family’s standard of living, Oun is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase cattle, which she intends to fatten and sell at market. 

In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and bigger to provide more convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and sell at market

loans.name: Basarbu

texts.ru:
Басарбу 57 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей.  Басарбу на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 8,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду Басарбу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 корова, 3 теленка, 10 овец, 2 лошади, 15 коз и 15 козлят. Также семья Басарбу ежегодно обрабатывает  1,60 га земли, где выращивает кукурузу, клевер и картофель. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Басарбу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку телят и овец - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Басарбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение деятельности.
texts.en: Basarbu is 57 years old, married and has six children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for 30 years, after starting this business with an mount of 8,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Basarbu's hard work, her business now contains one cow, three calves, ten sheep, two horses, fifteen goats and fifteen goat kids.  Basarbu's family also annually works on 1.60 hectares of land, where they grow corn, clover and potatoes.  In order to further develop her business, Basarbu requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy calves and lambs.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mahtovbi

texts.ru: Махтовби жительница района Хамадони. Она портниха. Ей 41 год. Махтовби более 23 лет занимается шитьем. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mahtovbi is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  She is a seamstress.  She is 41 years old.  Mahtovbi has been involved in sewing for over 23 years.  She has four children.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Savlatbi

texts.ru: Савлатби более десяти лет занимается торговлей. Она замужем. Ей 43 года. У нее двое детей. В основном она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Кредит берет для приобретения весенней детской одежды.
texts.en: Savlatbi has been involved in sales for over ten years.  She 43 years old, married and has two children.  She is primarily involved in selling children's clothing.  Savlatbi is requesting this loan to purchase spring children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase spring children's clothing

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Cheryl is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Klowng

texts.en:
Klowng is 33 years old. She is married to her spouse and is blessed with two school-age children. Her goal is to improve her quality of life and help her children get a good education. She wants them to become knowledgeable, so they may have good jobs in the future without working in a type of physical work as she does. She’s a humble rice farmer and, in addition, she works as a sewing staff member for a garment factory and normally gets her salary monthly. She has been in this business since 2008. 

She would like to borrow a .loan to buy cows to keep for the maintenance on her farm. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, she has a strong determination to uplift their status of living and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Srey Oun

texts.en:
Srey Oun, age 30, has been working in a garment factory for over five years, earning about USD 3 per day. She and her husband live in Takeo Province with their two children. Her husband is a taxi driver who earns about USD 5 per day. 

Due to the increased numbers of tourists in Cambodia, Srey Oun is requesting a loan in the amount of USD 1200 to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband, which he will use to provide public transportation service for tourists. This purchase will enable her husband to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a flat in Phnom Penh and to help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband, which he will use to provide public transportation service for tourists

loans.name: Francis Yanett

texts.es:
Doña Francis de 46 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos, ella vive con su conyugue el señor Nilsi quien es comerciante y le ayuda a vender ambulante en una carreta las golosinas, sus hijos van a la escuela y el mayor le ayuda en su negocio, ella vive en San Lorenzo, Honduras.
Dona Francis Tiene un pequeño negocio  en la afueras del mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, Ella vende artículos de achinería como ganchos para ropa, fajas, sandalias, bóxer, brasieres, calcetines y mucho mas, en su casa también ella prepara chicharrones de cerdos, frijoles en bolsa y tortillas. 
Necesita el préstamo para compra de producto para abastecer el negocio de achinería y comprar sandalias que son las que se venden en época de verano.
Doña Francis desea seguir teniendo más créditos con PRISMA ya que con las ganancias desea mejorar su casa y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Su sueño es ampliar más su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Doña Francis is 46 and is the mother of four children.  She lives with her husband, Nilsi, who works as a street vendor selling candy.  Their children go to school, and the oldest one helps her with her business.  She lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras.  Francis has a small business on the outskirts of the new market of San Lorenzo.  She sells low-cost merchandise like clothes hangers, belts, sandals, boxers, bras, socks, and much more.  She also makes chicharrones (friend pork skins), beans, and tortillas in her home.  She needs this loan to buy products to stock her merchandise and to buy sandals, which are what sells in the summer season.  Francis hopes to keep having more loans with Prisma since with her earnings, she hopes to improve her home and have a better quality of life.  Her dream is to expand her business more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March, 2012

loans.use: to buy underwear and personal use items for her business.

loans.name: Hâm

texts.en:
Hâm, age 52, is a hardworking and intelligent woman. She and her husband are raising four children at home, and they also have two grown children who are married and living with their own families around the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. 

For over 20 years she has been engaged in an agricultural business, cultivating rice within the rainy season of the year. She is trying to expand her business so that she may improve her family's overall well-being. 

She would like to receive her third cycle loan from HKL in order to purchase construction supplies to renovate the old house in which the family resides. She hopes that her loan will be approved and she thanks you in advance for your generosity and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to renovate the old house in which her family lives

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 42, lives in Migori County. She and her husband Maurice have five children who are enrolled in school.

Mary operates a clothes-selling business, a business she has operated for the last five years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 4,200. Mary is taking out her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. She will use the loan funds to buy a stock of clothes to offer for sale. 

Her profits will be used to ensure the education of her children. Their further education is her primary aspiration.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng, a 48-year-old farmer living in Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City, is married to 48-year-old Mr. Nov, a rice farmer and local fisherman. This couple works together in the farming business and has six single children, two of whom are employed as construction workers and help their parents meet the needs of the family.

Due to the dry season coming, Mrs. Sreng does not have enough funds for planting and so is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer, rice seed and a few fishing tools to help her husband catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seed and a few fishing tools for her husband.

loans.name: Nereo

texts.es: Nereo de 38 años de edad es soltero, labora para la municipalidad como maestro de obra desde hace 3½ años. Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de constrir un cuarto en su casa y asi tener mejores condiciones de vida familiar. Cabe señalar que Nereo con el credito anterior logro comprar una parte de los materiales para la construccion que ahora quiere hacer.
texts.en: Nereo is 38 years old. He is single and has worked for the city as a builder for 3 1/2 years. He is asking for his 2nd loan with the objective of building a room in his house and thus have better living conditions for his family. It is worth noting that with the previous loan he was able to buy some of the materials for the construction that he is about to do.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Griseld

texts.es: Griselda de 39 años de edad vive en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena,  ciudad  localizada a orillas del mar Caribe y  segundo centro urbano en importancia de la Costa Caribe colombiana, después de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Griselda es una mujer comerciante que inició su negocio, apoyada por su padre quien le mandó productos de papelería para la venta con los que le fue muy bien y gradualmente ella ha ido agregando la línea de ropa y calzado, con las cuales ha diversificado sus líneas de producto y expandido su mercado, visitando empresas y captando la atención de empleados que hoy son sus principales clientes, a quienes des da crédito por la compra de sus productos y ellos le pagan en partidas quincenales o mensuales, de acuerdo el plazo acordado con cada uno. Griselda hace un año ingreso a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y recibió su primer financiamiento, con el que logró aumentar su negocio, porque incrementó su capacidad de compra y con ello el reconocimiento de sus clientes. Hoy quiere continuar con este esquema y está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual surtirá su negocio con la compra de accesorios femeninos , calzado y ropa, que ya tiene encargada por sus clientes. Su meta mas adelante es tener una boutique en algún centro comercial famoso de la ciudad, pero su gran desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para lograrlo. Con su inversión logrará responder oportunamente a su clientela y aumentar un poco mas su capital de trabajo pues tiene una gran aceptación en el mercado y esta es justamente una condición de éxito futuro.
texts.en:
Griselda is 39, and lives in the beautiful city of Cartagena, located on the shores of the Caribbean. It is the second most important urban center on the Colombian Caribbean Coast, after the city of Barranquilla.

Griselda is a businesswoman who started her business supported by her father, who sent her stationery products to sell. It has gone very well, and gradually she has been adding the line of clothing and footwear. In this way she has diversified her product lines and expanded her market, visiting companies and attracting the attention of employees, who are today her main customers. 

She extends them credit for the purchase of her products and they pay her back in bi-weekly or monthly installments, in accordance with the terms agreed upon in each case.

Griselda joined the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a year ago, and received her first loan, through which she succeeded in increasing her business, because she increased her purchasing capacity and customer approval. Now she wants to continue with this plan, and is applying for her credikiva loan, which she will use to stock her business with women's accessories, footwear and clothing, that has already been ordered by her customers.

Her goal is to someday have a boutique in some well known shopping center in the city, but her great challenge is the insufficient working capital she has for achieving this. With her investment, she will succeed in responding to her customers appropriately, and increase her working capital a bit more. Her  business is very popular in the market, and this is exactly what is needed for future success.

loans.use: To buy women's accessories, footwear and clothing.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael de 25 años de edad es soltero, labora para la municipalidad como ayudante de albañil desde hace 3½ años. Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de terminar la construccion de un cuarto en su casa y asi tener mejores condiciones de vida familiar. Cabe señalar que a pesar de ser muy joven es muy trabajador, y con el credito anterior compro una parte de los materiales para la construccion de su cuarto y en este momento desea llevar a cabo la obra, ademas como el sabe de construccion le va a salir mas barato porque se ahorrara un poco la mano de obra.
texts.en: Misael is 25 and single.  He has worked for the city as an assistant bricklayer for 3 1/2 years.  He is requesting his third loan with the objective of finishing a room on his home so his family will have better living conditions.  It's fitting to point out that despite being very young, he is very hard-working.  With his previous loan, he bought part of the materials to construct the room, and now he hopes to complete the project.  He also knows that the construction will be cheaper now because he will save some on the labor.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Resin

texts.en:
Resin is thirty-five years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Resin provides motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She also makes and sells candles in different sizes. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy gasoline for the motorela services and the materials she needs to make candles. 

Resin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Resin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for the motorela service and the materials she needs to make candles.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is fifty-four years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Esther has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for twenty years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Esther has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Esther hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a thirty-five-year-old man from Migori. He is married to Milka and they have two children aged between two and seven.

Paul owns a retail shop. He has been running this kind of business for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is now taking a second loan which he will use to buy retail stock like sugar and cooking fat.

His profits will be used to repay the loan. His dream is to have a big retail shop.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over 4 years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns approximately USD 7 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Phen wants to run an additional business. 

With this goal in mind, Phen is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase fish to breed in order to resell them when they gain weight. This loan would enable her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to breed in order to resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia lives in Yei. She has a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is twenty-nine years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Sadia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 SDG in order to purchase tomatoes and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and beans to sell.

loans.name: Phait

texts.en:
Phet, twenty-eight, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in breeding poultry for over six years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who approximately earns USD 6 per day. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Phet is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase construction materials for her husband to use in his construction work. This purchase will enable her husband to get enough tools to use in his work. In the future, she would like to help her children get bachelor’s degrees and build fence around the house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her husband to use in his construction work.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 38 years old and married with 4 children.  With all her children in school, Rachel works very hard to provide for them.

Rachel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Rachel has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soap, soft-drinks and beverages. 

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susana is forty-three years old and one of her children is in school.

Susana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

Susana has been in this business for fifteen years. In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

Myrna has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is fifty years old. A mixed crop farmer, he is married to Mary, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been in farming for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joseph will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy keeping.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
